author: {'steamid': '76561198188664927', 'num_games_owned': 1605, 'num_reviews': 386, 'playtime_forever': 1130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1012, 'last_played': 1574612873}
review:
[h1] Game Summary: [/h1] 
Crimsonland is an aptly named twin-stick, overhead shooter, as killing hundreds of enemies stains the floor red with their blood.  This is the primary focus of the game, as there's no story or rationale for what's going on.  You're simply thrown into a situation where you need to blast away waves of enemies, being given plenty of fun toys to make that exciting.  With no other complications to address, here's the breakdown.  


[h1] Pros: [/h1] 
	â€¢ There are 7 types of survival mode available, each with a unique twist.  Unless you're incredibly good though, many of these attempts will end quickly, because the game holds nothing back.  I don't find these modes very engaging due to how soon you're killed off.  I know I'd die eventually, but having taken down the game on the hardest difficulty, I'd expect to put up a better fight. 
	â€¢ The main game mode contains 7 worlds, each made up of 10 levels, with the last level always being a boss fight.  You can't skip around in the game, having to unlock every stage in order.  There are three difficulty modes available, but they work the same way, requiring you to beat the game on one to advance to the next.  You start on normal, progress to grim, and end on hardcore.
	â€¢ There's a reasonable amount of enemy variety to fight through including lizards, aliens, zombies, spiders, crabs(?), and beetles.  There's different types of them as well, such as ones that shoot projectiles.  
	â€¢ As you fight enemies, you earn experience and level-up.  For each level-up you're given four perks to select from, get a temporary shield, and all nearby enemies are shoved away.    
	â€¢ The rock/metal music is just the right accompaniment for a game like this.


[h1] Cons: [/h1] 
	â€¢ The harder difficulties in quest mode don't feel very different from normal mode.  Playing the first stage on grim mode is a punch to the gut, as it's surprisingly hard.  However, this is an anomaly, as following stages mellow out again.  As it turns out, enemies don't take any more hits and typically aren't replaced with stronger foes, there's simply more of them.  Looking at the number of kills for stage 1-4  for each difficulty, I killed 180, 216, and 252 enemies, while on stage 5-7 I killed 224, 283, and 307 enemies.  5-7 had enemy spawners, but I focused on them early each time.  Assuming these numbers are typical for every stage, each difficulty increased the number of enemies by about 40?  
	â€¢ The perks are really unbalanced.  For instance, fast reload, health regeneration, and poison bullets will almost always be worth getting.  Others rely heavily on the stage or weapon you have, such as stationary reload or the laser sight.  Some seem completely worthless, such as the death clock, which grants more points but kills you in 30 seconds.  Since these are randomly generated each level-up, you're at the mercy of dumb luck.  
	â€¢ The final boss is lame, especially in contrast to bosses from earlier worlds, which seemed to be building up to a daunting final challenge.  However, it's so anticlimactic that I wound up beating it with full health the first time through.  Plus, it's not even thematically interesting, like a boss-spawner or the presumed source of all the problems (like an alien mothership).
	â€¢ The difficulty isn't consistent.  Some later world stages are rather difficult, but stages before and after those difficulty spikes will be as easy as ever.  Additionally, different attempts on the same stage can vary widely, from a walk in the park to a desperate bid to survive.  
	â€¢ Frankly, I think the character is too slow.  Some enemies are faster than you, and due to how badly you're outnumbered, you sometimes can't kill them fast enough.  It's one reason the Spideroid boss is so broken, as the small spiders outrun and corner you.  
	â€¢ Sometimes enemies will walk in from the edge of the screen, but they often spawn randomly in the middle of the stage.  There's no warning they're coming, so they can spawn right on top of you and wipe you out.  


[h1] Tips: [/h1]
	â€¢ The weapons you're able to fight with, besides your starter gun, will show up on the map randomly, but it only shows the picture for it.  You'll have to memorize your preferred weapons and know their general effects to know when it's good to swap out or if it'll only worsen your situation.  
	â€¢ There seems to be no disadvantage to playing with other people, as there aren't more enemies present and they don't take more damage to kill (based on 2 player coop on quest mode).  


[h1] Conclusion: [/h1] 
Having conquered quest mode, battled through a few rounds of the different survival modes available, and left with only a few achievements to complete, I've got just under 17 hours invested into this game.  I don't expect it'll take much longer to polish off the rest of the game, at which point, I don't see myself coming back for more.  So, at $14 I would say the game is a bit high, especially with gameplay that doesn't change much from start to finish.  Despite satisfying a basic urge for mayhem, the main downside to a mindless shooter like this is that once you run out of objectives, you lose anything to focus on and to drive you to play further.  When I was younger I could have played a game like this exhaustively, but my tastes have changed since then.  As long as you have a goal to works towards though the game is quite fun.  Therefore, I recommend it for those in search of a challenging twin-stick shooter that's not a bullet-hell.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089683297', 'num_games_owned': 1528, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 1493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1440, 'last_played': 1578338427}
review:
[code]If you enjoyed this review, please consider following my Curator Page [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33864135/]Nep's Gaming Paradise (Nepiki Gaming)[/url] for more reviews![/code]

[h1]Nepiki's Stats[/h1]
[table]
    [tr]
        [td]Overall length[/td]
        [td]4-5 hours for one playthrough, 20-25 hours for completion.[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Overall difficulty[/td]
        [td]Medium difficulty. Some achievements can get annoying but with enough practice you should overcome them eventually.[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Overall score[/td]
        [td][b]â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜†[/b][/td]
    [/tr]
[/table]

[h1]Review[/h1]
This game is super fun. A twin-stick top-down shooter with a crazy amount of weapons, perks and modes to play. By doing the campaign I kept unlocking more and more and that felt really good, and due to the variety in weapons and perks I occasionally experimented with them to check which combinations I like the most. While some would argue that some weapons are downright useless, I have used at least all of them once and combined them with perks to at least get some use out of them. There are some slight and weird difficulty spikes throughout the game however. Gamers who have played this game are probably familiar with the first stage on the hardest difficulty, or the almost endlessly reproducing spider boss stage. And after that, it just becomes really easy again. The same goes for the extra modes, but this only applies to achievements as they are endless modes.

[hr]

https://store.steampowered.com/app/262830/

author: {'steamid': '76561198082856200', 'num_games_owned': 273, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 954, 'last_played': 1603220442}
review:
Summary: Crimsonland is one of those games that you just tend to go back to time and time again. Whenever you are looking for that frantic and chaotic action-packed experience, Crimsonland is always the game that satisfies that craving. 9/10

A full video review of the game can be viewed here:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wn_k2d3T9RQ

Gameplay:
Of what issues I have with Crimsonland, they are only minor and donâ€™t affect the gameplay as a whole, resulting in an excellent top-down shooter experience that you are bound to come back to time and time again. Playing through the newer and updated version of Crimsonland has been an absolute joy. It has everything that made the original so much fun and expands on that making a bigger and better experience that will keep you hooked until you have mastered everything the game has to offer.

It is action-packed, fast-paced and has as much replayability as any roguelike game will ever have. And if you love playing games from time to time that is just mindless and over the top bloody mess action, then Crimsonland is going to greatly satisfy your chaos craving.

Atmosphere:
The atmosphere of Crimsonland is great. Throughout the whole experience, you have this fantastic rock soundtrack that fits in perfectly with the over the top and frantic action that the gameplay presents. But it isnâ€™t just the soundtrack that makes the atmosphere of Crimsonland work, but the sound effects too.

From the sounds of the weapons firing to the splattering effects of enemies being hit and shredded to pieces to each of enemies death sound effect. They all add to the atmosphere which is one of chaos that complements the equally as chaotic nature of the game. It is such a strange atmosphere, almost alien but it is one that completely absorbs you into the game and its strange world of absolute destruction and monster slaying madness, all the while making you feel like a total badass in the process.

Conclusion:
Crimsonland is one of those games that you just tend to go back to time and time again. Whenever you are looking for that frantic and chaotic action-packed experience, Crimsonland is always the game that satisfies that craving. Its gameplay is at first glance simple, but there is a depth to it that only truly reveals itself the further you progress into the game. And the more you play the more you become absorbed into it.

The gameplay is solid, action-packed and an absolute joy to play, the weapons and perks varied, plentiful and full of experimentation. The atmosphere is chaotic and frantic fitting in with the gameplay and the survival modes are a varied and fun bash that will keep you occupied for hours. Crimsonland is an absolute joyride of action, gore and exploding enemies that was great in 2003 and has only gotten better with the re-release. And with that, I give Crimsonland a 9 out of 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972066321', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 19713, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9736, 'last_played': 1705365262}
review:
There are aliens.  There are lizard people.  There are giant spiders.  There are zombies.

What do these things have in common?

They make amazing targets.

Crimsonland is a top-down shooter from 10tons Ltd.  It has simple controls and simple gameplay, and yet it has amazing replayability.  You can do the quests and try to get perfect scores on each, or you can play one of the many survival modes.  Monsters drop various weapons and power-ups, and each kill gets you closer to a perk that can give you regeneration, increase your damage, reduce your reload speed, or have a special effect like flipping a coin to see if you get a fat chunk of experience or a fat chunk of dead.

My buddy gave me Crimsonland, and I have since gone on to purchase a large portion of 10tons catalog.  It is a fun game that you can play for a few minutes or a few hours, over and over again.

I give it 4.5/5 Nachos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138217105', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1529, 'last_played': 1567976508}
review:
The game is great, you shoot a bunch of aliens and there's a lot of powerups and perks that give quite a bit of variety to the game. This is a remaster, there are some differences compared to the old 2003 version, some make it better, some worse. I got used to it, at least it has more levels and then you can play it for a longer time! The levels never get boring, that's a great pro for this game. I didn't feel once that it was repetitive, even though I played it 3 times on all 3 difficulties. 

It's a shame there's no online multiplayer, but there is only one truly terrible thing about this game : NUKEFISM mode and the achievement for it. This should really be deleted, it's complete garbage and has almost no connection to the real game! How can you play Crimsonland if you don't have a gun?! What kind of game is that?

author: {'steamid': '76561198083447246', 'num_games_owned': 289, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1136, 'last_played': 1645927373}
review:
[h1] CRIMSONLAND [/h1]
[b] 5 euros [/b]

Cimsonland's strengths lie in it's gameplay, which is fast paced but also requires thought and strategy. Pummeling through waves of enemies is incredibly fun when combined with the perk choosing at each level that makes each survival game different. 

Unlocking a greater variety of weapons and perks through a campaign mode at first sounds like a roadblock but is actually a fun detour from the core gameplay to tighter more specific challenges that require using weapons/perks in specific situations tailored to them.

The biggest flaw is the visuals, which have aged poorly, being incredibly dull and monotone, specially in the early stages of a round, and even when filled with particles and energy blasts still of low quality. Also excessive blood make the visuals even more of a mess and sometimes can even get in the way of gameplay.

Crimsonland is one of those rare gems that allows your PC to be a local gaming machine, allowing multiple players to join in coop survival an campaign. 

[table] [tr] [th] Even with its unpleasant visuals, it is a great top-down shooter and knowledge of the perks allows for great strategic planning which is uncommon in basic zombie survival games these days. If on sale it is definitely worth the price. [/th] [/tr] [/table]

[h1] 5/10 [/h1]

review:
Charming old title, a follow-up to the game that basically invented this sub-genre.

It's a top-down shooter with lots of different weapons, perks and builds. Not all builds are created equal but it's still very enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133050605', 'num_games_owned': 840, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 734, 'last_played': 1507070754}
review:
Crimsonland ist anstrengend.

So kann man das Spiel ganz gut beschreiben, muss aber nicht heiÃŸen das es schlecht ist.

Es ist ein Twin-Stick Shooter mit vielen starken und schwachen Waffen. Die Waffen braucht man um irgendwelche Alien Insekten/Tiere/Menschen zu killen, die alle unterschiedliche Wege haben um die effizienter zu killen. Und dann killt man so fÃ¼r 10 Stunden seine Insekten mit Waffen die es in jedem Futuristischen Shooter geben soll, und sammelt nebenbei paar Items auf den paar Maps ein welche die so schon geilen Waffen NOCH geiler machen.

Das Spiel hat nicht viele Level, dafÃ¼r sind die so schwer das man die meisten erst nach 10 versuchen schaft.
Und dann startet man neu, und wieder, und wieder, bis man keine lust hat oder die Mom einen zum essen zwingt (dumme Hur3 geh arbeiten...).

Man schaltet die Waffen als auch Items durch siege frei und das ist immer sehr "befriedigend" (klingt sehr schwul ich weiÃŸ), EGAL bei welcher Waffe.

Ich kenne das Spiel nun schon seit Ã¼ber 5 Jahren, und das nur weil ich das Spiel damals als On-Rails Version auf dem Handy hatte (auf meinem ersten TOUCH Handy <3), es macht heute wie damals sÃ¼chtig.
FÃ¼r mich ist Crimsonland wie fÃ¼r andere Binding of Isaac.
Die Entwickler sind auch sehr nett und brachten bis vor kurzen noch Updates raus.

Ein toller Indie Shooter!
Bitte ein umfangreichen Nachfolger mit mehr Levels und Waffen und Items und Insekten/Tieren/Menschen UND MEHR VON ALLEM!!1

author: {'steamid': '76561198121797462', 'num_games_owned': 436, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1606737668}
review:
The twin-stick shooter I grew up with. It's probably the only one I'm willing to play while also enjoying it.

The 2014 remake, found here on Steam and GOG, is basically another mobile port released for PC. While the controls are not impacted, the GUI is a bit too bulky for me, but it's passable, because the remastered monsters look SO GOOD!

Plus, the original is also included in the package... Can it get any better?

author: {'steamid': '76561198012674658', 'num_games_owned': 451, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 10247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8128, 'last_played': 1699715371}
review:
This is the most relaxing game ever. 
I have had it installed since the old version and been playing the Blitz Survival mode as a sort of meditation. To be honest it actually helped me out mentally.
You really can let go, relax your mind and shoot some monsters while picking up perks and bonuses. Its all super satisfying. 
The replayability is infinite times 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198859215999', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 2872, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1308, 'last_played': 1559876253}
review:
This is a game that could have been much better than it is, there is fun to be had in it
it is fun in bursts to play though it is kind of sad they put so much emphasis on luck instead of skill
as the core game play feels solid , but i'd say it's worth it for a deep discount


+ fun 
+ lots of weapons & perks

- random spawning of monster without warning or sign is main reason for dying
- bland level backgrounds & aesthetics
- bad inconsistent UI
- game crashed on me after getting to the tens of million range in survival (it crashes sometimes)
- running ads  in a paid game


if you like twin stick shooters and don't mind that it creates too much of its tension from luck - 
spawning/weapons/perks, than you should still try it, you'd probably have a good time

author: {'steamid': '76561198014763908', 'num_games_owned': 2519, 'num_reviews': 331, 'playtime_forever': 2381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2381, 'last_played': 1556299105}
review:
With a very fitting soundtrack, amazingly fun and big mix of weapons, perks and power-ups and the ability to speed the gameplay up by 1.5x creates an epic, fast-paced twin-stick gore-fest of a game that is extremely difficult to beat on the highest difficulty.

This game has received many updates throughout it's release on Steam and I think the game is currently at a good state of balance.
Including many other changes, the biggest is that previously you could not use perks in the quest game mode, which you now can by enabling it from the options menu, which was a part of the original 2003 game.
I don't understand what made the developers think it was a good idea to remove these things at launch, but I'm very glad they changed their mind and added them back in.

I have not played co-op in this game as I have no friends with interests in this game, but I've watched many videos of co-op gameplay before writing this and it looks super fun, so if you have friends looking for some games to play, this should definitely be on your list.

If you're planning on getting 100% achievements in this game, which I love to do with games I thoroughly enjoy, no matter the difficulty, good luck, you'll need it.
Completing the game is a big enough challenge, completing it while remaining at full health at the end of each level, even if just on normal difficulty, is, well... a long and fun grind. The sense of accomplishment once you manage to do it is just great.
[i]Tip: Disable blood in the settings. You can't have it on if you plan on beating this game on Grim difficulty or completing normal mode with full health at the end of each level, it makes the thousands of enemies too hard to spot fast enough with the blood obscuring the battlefield.[/i]

The game has 7 extra game modes apart from the main quest mode:
Survival: Survival mode with perks, power-ups and weapons.
Rush: Assault Rifle-only mode.
Weapon Picker: Randomly spawning weapons, each weapon only has 1 magazine.
Nukefism: No weapons or perks, survive by collecting power-ups in a strategic manner.
Blitz: Ultra-fast survival mode with perks, power-ups and weapons.
Waves: Wave-style gameplay.
Typ'o'Shooter: Use your typing skills to kill enemies.

This is where I have some negative things to say.

Apart from Typ'o'Shooter, Rush and Nukefism, the rest of these game modes depend purely on luck[i], and before I continue, in case it needs to be said, of course you need to be at a certain skill level, of course if you're bad at the game you can get the perfect combination of luck and still lose 30 seconds in.[/i]

Anyways, apart from the aforementioned game modes you lay in the arms of lucks mercy.
No matter how good you are there's only a few weapons in these game modes that will get you anywhere, which doesn't sound too bad, just restart until you find the weapon you need, sounds easy enough, right? Not really, because on top of the few weapons you also need an almost perfect combination of the first 4 or 5 perks.
If you do not get these, you need to restart and try again to see if you get lucky the next time, so if you want to get 100% achievements, which includes getting pretty high scores in these game modes, get ready to click the restart button hundreds of times, [b]literally[/b].

Apart from that they are still really fun, and once you actually do start to get a really high score you feel really good, again it's just super fun, but it takes a really long time before you get the needed combination of weapon and perks to get a high score.
I understand that is it difficult to balance such a game mode, that doesn't mean it should be ignored though.

The game also offers a 2048-style 'combine the gems' hidden game mode which gives you an achievement if you beat the pre-set high-score. This is an incredibly difficult puzzle game and honestly not fun at all, but hey... gotta get that achievement, right?
Upon purchase you also get the epic, original 2003 version of Crimsonland.


[h1]Curator page[/h1]

[i]If you liked this review or otherwise found it helpful in deciding whether or not to buy this game, feel free to follow [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/29162366/]my Curator page[/url].[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198044841209', 'num_games_owned': 4387, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 471, 'last_played': 1555880596}
review:
The challenges in this game are infuriating. Well, I should say "the challenge". Beating levels is nice, but if you can beat a level without taking damage, you get a stupid yellow star next to it.

I thought I would try for fun. It was a nice little shooter experience that I could pick up and play when I wanted to zone out.

Unfortunately, 10tons failed to create a satisfying experience. The whole concept of RNG on top of RNG combined with bullshit mechanics that were just not designed to enable no damage. Most of the levels are possible and even easy, but randomly you will hit a level that is really shitty. Shooting enemies, huge groups (enemies that spawn enemies when you kill them etc).

You play it over and over hoping the first weapon drop is good. You wait for the right perks to be offered. It is a miserable experience.

The way I see it, the problem is the levels weren't really designed. They just dropped a bunch of ingredients in a pot and hoped for the best.

Go to your kitchen, randomly select 5 ingredients and prepare them using a random cooking method. It's probably going to taste like shit, just like this game.

Note: The original experience is available, and it's actually good. It knew the limits of it's mechanics. If you don't care about doing no damage runs, you will probably have a lot more fun with this. You are still subject to the whims of weapon+perk RNG, but it is a lot less punishing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004125261', 'num_games_owned': 1399, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1691411500}
review:
Played the crap out of this back in the day. It's a solid little top-down shooter with levels to progress through, unlocking more perks, weapons, levels and modes.

If you're happy paying asking price, then do so, but I'd personally wait for a sale; I originally bought the non-steam version for USD$10, and although there has been some more work done to it since then, I do think that's a fair price to wait for.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008207726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 7091, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3504, 'last_played': 1710707514}
review: Absolute masterpiece, does not get boring nor old, great and simple entertainment, multiple fun game modes, many mutators which make every approach very different. If you expect a solid 2D, top-view monster wave shooter, this is a must-have for you, without a doubt. Unlocking all achievements is a bit, least to say, difficult, but knowing some of the in-game quirks you will pass 2.10 Spideroids level on Grim difficulty in about 1 minute.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969196040', 'num_games_owned': 1199, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1553401481}
review:
Simple. Fun. Easily worth 5 bucks.

While this doesn't have the fluidity or fast-paced action of Tesla v. Lovecraft (nor does it have either Tesla or Lovecraft), it's certainly a fine predecessor and, even after spending rather a bit of time with TvL, Crimsonland is a nice spot of twin-stick shooting. (I do recommend an M+K setup vs controller, though, unlike with TvL.)

While I don't have anyone to play local-coop with, it seems integrated in a fine fashion with drop-in/out play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115472809', 'num_games_owned': 1011, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1892, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1784, 'last_played': 1563994415}
review:
Crimsonland â€“ my first 10tons game. 
Gameplay progression: You start out with just a pistol and run around shooting creatures and zombies until either you die or eliminate all hostiles. Thatâ€™s every single level, which you start on Normal mode, then progress to Hardcore, then Grim.
There is some uniqueness in a few of the levels where you start out with a specific weapon and canâ€™t change it, but the level is usually created in a way that favors the weapon you are given. 

Weapons: Crimsonland has a whole lot of them. Youâ€™ll find out that some weapons are trash, and others are the next best thing to Christmas day. There are powerups that favor certain weapons to make them even better, which is nice if you can get the right ones. 

Cons: What makes this game really frustrating is the problem of randomness. All weapon spawns are random, all perks are random, and all powerups are random. The only way to progress through the survival modes and certain levels is to get the exact combination of perks and weapons that favors a certain style, otherwise you are going to die pretty quickly. 

Pricing: I wouldnâ€™t pay full price for this game because of the lack of customization, but on sale it is an amazing steal.

Overall score: 7.5/10

review: The 2003 release of crimsonland is one of my favourite childhood games. This version is just as good - The quests provide a fun challenge with a progressive increase in difficulty. review: Fajna nawalanka, w ktÃ³rej po uruchomieniu po prostu walisz oÅ‚owiem do obcych bez zbÄ™dnego wgryzania siÄ™ w historiÄ™ czy strategiÄ™ gry. Czy moÅ¼na chcieÄ‡ czegoÅ› wiÄ™cej :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198002193644', 'num_games_owned': 922, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1656986833}
review:
(Ignore the playtime; I've put 45 hours into the Switch version, as well.)

Honestly, this is one of the best when it comes to PURE top-down shoot 'em up games, like the wave survival games I loved growing up. Robotron, Phobia II, (and later) Dracula: Undead Awakening, etc.

Tons of weapons, perks, and a decent amount of modes. Playing through all 180 levels of the campaign (60 levels at 3 difficulties) truly feels like an accomplishment, especially with the difficulty of the final set. You'll be required to to get all weapons, anyway.

 If you want pure, unadulterated top-down survival ShMup action, I can safely recommend this title on any system.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978476477', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2567, 'last_played': 1516452297}
review:
LowCo.-Bericht:

Zu Zeiten der Jahrtausendwende wurde dieser Topdown Shooter geboren. Horden um Horden von Gegnern verfolgen bloss ein Ziel, dich auszuradieren. Und das wirklich gut gemacht. 
Man startet mittig auf einer Map, bewaffnet mit Pistole und nach und nach spawnen die Gegner, die bei ihrem Ableben teils Items wie Waffen, RÃ¼stung oder AtomsprengkÃ¶pfe, die den ganzen Bildschirm von Feinden befreien, droppen. Es handelt sich bei den Gegnern um Mutanten, Spinnen und solche Konsorten, manche sogar unsichtbar.
Es existiert ein XP System, man sammelt Erfahrung, durch die nach kurzer Zeit bei einem Level Up sogenannte Perks ausgewÃ¤hlt werden kÃ¶nnen, die man im Singleplayer freischaltet. Beispiele dafÃ¼r sind zum Beispiel schnelleres Nachladen, oder Items praktisch magnetisch Richtung Spieler zu bewegen.
In diesem Topdown Arena Style reiht sich Crimsonland ganz ganz oben ein, meiner Meinung nach in dieser Kategorie sogar unerreicht. 
Das reihenweise (auch sehr blutige) Zerfetzen von Gegnern macht tierisch Spass, und auch im Multiplayer ist diese Schlachtplatte ein Hammer, wenn auch vielleicht nicht auf eine unfassbare Dauer.
AuÃŸerdem ist es ein super Game fÃ¼r Zwischendurch, gerade im Kampagnenmodus hat man zÃ¼gig die ein oder andere Map erledigt.
Definitiv eine Kaufempfehlung, gerade im Sale. Erste Wahl, wenn man auf diese Spiele steht.

Mit freundlichen GrÃ¼ÃŸen
Lowded

author: {'steamid': '76561198006678256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2545, 'last_played': 1661063131}
review: This is probably the only "old" game I keep coming back again and again. Having played it the first time way back in 2003 during my few free hours working at a hostel Crimsonland is the only game that I can't really get tired of. It is to top-down shooters what Tetris is to, well, Tetris games. Easy to pick up, play for a while and then put down, only to pick it up again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138883859', 'num_games_owned': 14, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1733, 'last_played': 1601478628}
review:
Una joya de juego, ha mejorado un montÃ³n con respecto al antiguo que saliÃ³ por 2003 si no me equivoco (aunque en realidad lo juguÃ© por 2008).
Llega a ser un poco frustrante en cierto punto, hay pantallas que son extremadamente difÃ­ciles, pero es una total satisfacciÃ³n pasarlas.
Una pena que los records en el modo survival sean una exageraciÃ³n y por lo que veo son records cheteados a lo que es imposible poder llegar a alcanzarlos.
Tiene un montÃ³n de modos de juegos por lo que no se vuelve tan monÃ³tono.
TambiÃ©n cuenta con una gran variedad de enemigos, desde araÃ±as, zombies, aliens y muchas otras criaturas de todos los tipos y colores.
No podrÃ­a faltar nombrar la cantidad de armas que hay, y es que son impresionantes, habiendo las clÃ¡sicas como las pistolas, metralletas, escopetas, bazookas, lanzallamas, hasta pistolas que lanzan ondas de sonido, bazookas de 6 disparos a la vez, metralletas con municiÃ³n elÃ©ctrica, y algunas que ni sÃ© como â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥s nombrarlas. A pesar de eso, no vas a contar con todas las armas en el momento, tienes que ir cogiendolas a medida que aparecen en el mapa matando a un enemigo y en orden aleatorio, por lo que muchas veces toca dudar si cambiar de arma o no.

Pros:
-La variedad de enemigos.
-La variedad de armas y mejoras temporales.
-Muchos modos de juego.
-La mÃºsica, aunque no sea variada estÃ¡ muy buena.
-El detale grÃ¡fico. 
-Modo coop local.
-Cromos.

Contras:
-El precio (aunque se puede conseguir muy barato por cualquier lado)
-Los records del modo survival estÃ¡n fuera de tema.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003575604', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1542851089}

author: {'steamid': '76561198847001469', 'num_games_owned': 1802, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 1502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 534, 'last_played': 1655793649}
review:
Worth every penny of the full price, but on sale so often you wouldn't have to wait too long for it to be cheaper.  Got it in a bundle on Fanatical that I bought for other games, but I'm so glad I did because this is probably the most satisfying arcade-style game this side of Gauntlet.

A flat-map arena shooter where you simply kill waves of various forms of boogins, it's deceptively strategic without getting too up its own ass like real strategy games do.  With a monstrous roster of fun powerups and almost as many crazy guns, it'd take years to have the same run of a level.

Playing quests or survival modes by yourself is fun enough, but the couch co-op is a real blast.  It's a great way for you and a friend or s/o to unwind after a stressful day at work.  The normal mode is easy enough but can be challenging while the Nightmare and Grim modes are for when you want to bead sweat on your furrowed brow over a video game for whatever reason.

Despite being a dated premise for a game (and also just a remake of their own 2003 demo), this is hugely addictive and hasn't gotten stale yet after hundreds of waves of enemies.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999464211', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3622, 'last_played': 1551644123}
review: Crimsonland is an amazingly fun game, especially given how old it is (orginally dating back to 2003)! The current steam incarnation is a very nice re-release which keeps the best features of the original and improves on them. The best part of this game is that the developer (10tons) keeps adding to it! Not content to rest on their laurels as they release a slew of new games (Tesla vs Lovecraft, etc), they not too long ago added a whole new section to CL to make it new again. Thus, CL is still my go-to game for a quick areana shooter fix, on PC, Mac, and on the go (iOS). This is why I have nominated CL for the Labor of Love Award.  Sorry TvL, I love you too, but you're not old enough yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970538611', 'num_games_owned': 569, 'num_reviews': 241, 'playtime_forever': 739, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 739, 'last_played': 1540155251}
review:
I normally avoid arena shooters but this one won me over with its gentle difficulty curve, massive arsenal of perks and weapons, and a hearty suite of extraneous survival modes. Isometric action games are a staple of this developer's portfolio (Neon Chrome, Tesla versus Lovecraft) and they have clearly come a long way in perfecting the art on a shoe-string budget.

The game, like many, advertises itself as "local multiplayer best played on a game pad". I still find this curious as mouse + keyboard trumps twin sticks any day of the week. And who in their right mind is going to bring this title to a LAN party with so many other, better, options? Maybe while the guys are taking a bathroom break in between rounds of Killing Floor.

Regardless, if you're a gamer who likes the challenge of being outnumbered 10,000 to 1 at the mercy of random weapon drops Crimsonland is worth a dozen or so hours of harmless, mindless, pulse-pounding action.

review:
This game is just darned fun when you figure it out. Using the right weapon for the right monster is key. 

Powerup save the day. Drawbacks? Some levels are very hard and I do not see how it is possible to win. 

A bit expensive but I had a ton of fun and so did my friends I got to buy this. IF its on sale just buy it, it is very fun.

review:
I play this game over and over. The assortment of weapons is simply incredible. Likewise having the capacity to coop makes it a simple pick when somebody comes over. You can hope to get around 8-12 long periods of gameplay, contingent upon how hard you get into it. A fun and addictive best down shooter. Useful for short blasts and the gameplay is extremely fulfilling and fun. 
Would suggest this game marked down.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126106060', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 784, 'last_played': 1703364033}
review: I always come back to play this at some point. It is not an indepth kinda game. Move, reload, shoot, thats about it. Good range of skill level settings to keep it from from going stale, and the random gun and power ups keeps it from playing the same way. Simple AI keeps the dumb circle walk from working, THANK YOU. When I want simple, mindless, killing in an arena, this is my go too. I have gotten my money out of this one and then some.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996860630', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 2387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2357, 'last_played': 1517117245}
review: For when you need to cover your screen with gibs.  Use mods when the game starts to feel slow.  Firing rockets into packed monsters so you can stand in the temporary clear space long enough to do it again is a great way to wake up, vent steam, chill, enjoy a drink, listen to your significant other, listen to the news, wait for the coffee pot to finish, wait for your significatnt other to finish their damn hair, wait for a download, cook a sandwich (check the kitchen frequntly or make sure the smoke detector works), pass 15 min or less of time you may be mismanaging in the first place but can't be bothered to think about that, ...

author: {'steamid': '76561198832735925', 'num_games_owned': 1860, 'num_reviews': 368, 'playtime_forever': 6646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1323, 'last_played': 1551505459}
review:
Este juego es muy bueno para pasar el rato. 
Los niveles son reducidos, lo cual es bueno para este juego, pues solo haces una cosa: matar aliens, lo se le da muy bien.
Tiene un gran nÃºmero de armas y potenciadores desbloqueables y ningÃºn juego es igual. Los controles son precisos y las grÃ¡ficas, aunque simples, cumplen su propÃ³sito, pues aun con la pantalla llena de enemigos puedes identificar con claridad que hace cada uno. 
Lo malo es que los potenciadores y las armas son completamente al azar, por lo que hace que algunas partidas seas la muerte cabalgando y otras un trozo de carnada.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085971951', 'num_games_owned': 177, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1534942010}
review: It's a pretty fun top down shooter. Each level you start at level 0 and can level up to choose randomized perk. The game might be a bit too randomized especially on weapon drops but's it's still pretty fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11196, 'playtime_forever': 869, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 869, 'last_played': 1534866312}
review:
Crimsonland is a simple top down 2D twin-stick style survival shooter where you shoot waves of monsters.   The simplistic gameplay is supported by an experience/progression tree as well as weapon unlocks.

Overall the simple gameplay and graphics don't work effectively to capture attention for long (my time in the game was mostly card idling).   As far as games in the genre go, it's still one of the better ones, but I can't see any justification for the $14 price tag on what might as well be a mobile game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054685013', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 962, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 909, 'last_played': 1653158304}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971658744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1662158429}
review:
(Note: a majority of my playtime is with the PS4 version). There is something absolutely satisfying about Crimsonland. It's the same kind of drive that makes classic games like Geometry Wars so much fun, albeit packaged in a totally different way. The game has no real level design to speak of, instead focusing on waves of enemies that change up with each level. You can pick up power ups, unlock new guns, earn perks, and change up the game in all kinds of ways.

I'm trying to figure out why I love this game so much, especially local co-op. I think it's the pure chaos of being swarmed by enemies, only to see a powerup on the other side of the level and completely changing up your strategy. It's unbalanced, as you can be completely screwed when starting a level if you don't get a good gun pickup, but the nice thing is that these levels are designed to be played quickly and restarted almost every time. Bonuses are given for not taking damage, something that is both impossible and absolutely possible in a span of two restarts. 

There's so much content here, and the drive to unlock new weapons and perks makes this game one of my favorites.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050750548', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 597, 'playtime_forever': 1108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1108, 'last_played': 1529156107}
review: Top down gore game with multiple game modes and 4 local players. I really enjoyed beating it 100%. It may get a little repetitive after the second run. However, is a great time killer thanks to the short missions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084921474', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1656040195}
review:
Crimsonland is a game that I enjoy, but concerns me. I purchased the 10tons shooters bundle on sale, and I noticed something. No matter which of the games I play, I would see an ad flash for another of their products on the home menu. 
I found this really tacky and intrusive, not to mention annoying (I own all the games these ads were trying to push). 

That being said, this game is still a rock solid horde-based top down shooter. I'm currently slaving on getting without a scratch for the normal campaign, which at times has difficulty spikes bigger than a walrus penis. This game revels in unfairness at times, so if that's a deterrent for you, I wouldn't reccommend this game. Shooting feels fluid and responsive, and the arena quickly becomes saturated in blood from your kills, resulting in a primal satisfaction.

The music for this game is cheesey and bad. I turned it off fairly quickly, and I listen to Avatar or some other nice melodeath band to get the ambience right. Your death sound is fairly close to what i'd imagine an old man sitting on a traffic cone would sound like. It's goofy, moving on-

In summary, I reccommend getting this game on sale. In today's market, there are top down shooters that do it much more stylishly and for far less money. The gameplay is still solid to this day. I hope this helped.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043818433', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1527751206}
review:
No real chellenge, and no real fun.  Just a bunch of gratuitous shooting with special effects.  Beat the whole game in one sitting, and the extra "difficulty" was nothing more than making a little change to what spawns, and possibly a little difference in stats.

In any case, this game is a complete waste of money, as no actual thought was put into its creativity.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034146309', 'num_games_owned': 2545, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 484, 'last_played': 1531093952}
review:
A nice Top-Down Shooter, even though repetitive and with some just unfun achievements, the huge amount of weapon and perks variety make up for it. Soundtrack is nothing special but the gameplay is quite satisfying.

You can expect to get around 8-12 hours of gameplay, depending on how hard you get into it.

Sadly, didn't got to test the Co-Op so I can't really give my opinion on that subject.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983740996', 'num_games_owned': 745, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 945, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 945, 'last_played': 1530971203}
review:
Crimsonland is a very simple twin-stick shooter that's a lot of fun and highly addictive. The different monster types offer different challenges and if you try to remain unhurt you will need to select your perks wisely.

Pros:
- it's fun
- addictive
- very many weapons
- very many perks
- rather short if you only play normal difficulty
- varied monsters that mean different challenges

Cons:
- hard and grim difficulty are impossible to beat

author: {'steamid': '76561198041151999', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1528596860}
review: Did you play this as a kid? Are you looking for some super duper nostalgia muder? Then yeah, buy it. It's the same game with a couple minor visual upgrades. Loved it then, love it now. Never played? Give it a shot. Tons of weapons, cool perks, and powerups. Once you've unlocked everything survival mode is top notch as well. I didn't have any proof that I bought it back in the day (for a hefty $20 in 2004 no less!) but I had no issue giving them another $5 on a sale. Get to commando!

author: {'steamid': '76561198080660815', 'num_games_owned': 136, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1042, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1654703711}
review:
Alright so this game is great for just slaughtering hordes and hordes of monsters. As the soldier says: "Its good, real good. Maybe even the best!" Seriously though, i love this game, but you should have a friend to play on local multiplayer. It is a lot of fun to just run around beating the levels (or for the spiders that split into hundreds more; sitting on the edge of your seat).
Give it a shot, its only a tenner which is cheaper than your average restaurant meal (and if a meal lasts longer than this game entertains you, reconsider the way you eat!)
Also the wide range of weapons with different ways to play makes it class if you like varying your play style and range.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050659872', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1533286726}
review:
Quite an enjoyable game.

-- Arcade Action where, basically, you take on waves of enemies, from a top down perspective, as a single trooper.

-- Tons of weapons, and power-ups

-- Lots of maps in the Story Mode, lots of Survival Modes

-- The one semi-unique thing about the game, I think, is that you basically get a random or starting weapon, and you can't change it until you "loot" a different weapon in the field of battle.   Last weapon you loot is the only weapon in your arsenal, so skip weapons you don't want to use.

-- Over 50 different weapons

-- Over 50 different power-ups or modifiers to your trooper, picked up as you go, fresh for each scenario in the Story Campaign, random basically in most other Survivor Modes.

------

Good graphics, well optimized at least for an Nvidia 750 Ti.

It is more fun than Nation Red, in that it is easier and each map takes less long to play, but Nation Red is harder and also very good.

-----

I'd get this game, if you don't have an arcade soldier shooter, and would like one.   I found each map took a minute or 2 to complete if you succeeded, some needed a few tries.  

I got this game as part of a large bundle from Fanatical.com when it was the old Bundlestars.com (just a name change), which is a reputable site and sometimes has great bundles or deals.   So I probably paid under a dollar for this game.

Definitely worth playing for some quick action, probably best to try and get it under $4.  But there are lots of other pretty good competitors.  This game has a bit more of a fun factor.   The power-ups and guns are imaginative, somehow the look is very upbeat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157065452', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 664, 'last_played': 1537016937}

author: {'steamid': '76561197960478145', 'num_games_owned': 2351, 'num_reviews': 616, 'playtime_forever': 675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 612, 'last_played': 1537210961}
review:
2 reasons to recommend this game. The first being the game is really good! Sure, it's a tad outdated graphical-wise, but the visuals are atmospheric, suit the gameplay well and pretty artistic (as far as the technical fidelity goes). Speaking of the gameplay, it's great! Sending tons of ugly critters back to hell (or wherever dimension they came from) while collecting weapons and an occasional powerup that blows up everything in sight never gets old. And there's couch-coop! To be honest, that's the only reason I like this game that much as I don't go for top-down shooters for solo fun, but it'd be great for people who dig that kind of stuff.

The other reason being the developers. The game came out in 2014 and I recently started having technical difficulties with it (as in "crash to desktop upon every start"). The developers released a patch that solves it. In 2018, mind you. I've seen big budget games with less support, than this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058423326', 'num_games_owned': 2180, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1643260005}
review:
Deceptively Fun!

This game is really one of those deceptively fun little gems where it is all about killing mass amounts of enemies on screen. The graphics are simple, but good given the nature of it. It goes on some deep sales and when it does it is certainly worth it. Check our the bundles available and see if its there, always worth it when it is.

Pros:
Twin stick shooting goodness with bar none amazing control.
Lots of Action
Lots of Perks
The quest mode gives you something to strive for.
GREAT WEAPON SELECTION. So many weapons that play so differently.

Cons:
No terrain to speak of, maps are a bit flat
Graphics are dated, given the age of the game this is expected.
No real end game.

Recommendation: If you find it on sale get it, don't look back. If your a twin stick shooter fan though wait for a sale, even though it is amazing beyond compare there are a few other games out there that will scratch your itch at a better price when it isn't on sale. If you find it on sale though, or in a bundle get it, it will surprise you with the depth of game play and just the sheer stress relief it provides.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122181156', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1275, 'last_played': 1518705184}
review: Crimsonland kicks arse! The biggest downside is the art style, I think it looks a bit ugly but the gameplay completely wipes away that complaint. As you get better at the game you memorise which perks and guns work well and you get into a complete flow state. You wouldn't need to add or subtract any of the features, it's damn near perfect. Play this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197981501403', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1636801447}
review:
Simple, casual, quick and fun.
When you want just blow away your depressing mood, play this.
You will get an instant catharsis.
Don't expect depth, story and spiritual elevation.
Enjoy killing a lot of zombies, insects fish and whatsoever simply for your funl.

author: {'steamid': '76561198807895398', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 887, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 567, 'last_played': 1519502967}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198045708814', 'num_games_owned': 1730, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1511487600}
review: This game was originally released in 2003 and it was great when I first played it. As soon as I've seen it on Steam i knew I had to play it again. How does it hold up? Pretty much the same (and that's a good thing). The gameplay is super simple - beat hordes of enemies with cool guns and even cooler abilities and upgrades. That's it. The graphics and sound/music are really nothing special (it wasn't a flashy game even in 2003.), but it's that simplicity is what kept it fun even today. Shooting and trying to overwhelm the enemy with gunfire before they overwhelm you is fun and exciting every time (especialy in the later levels). The difficulty scales nicely while you progress torough the levels unlocking more guns and perks along the way. Crimsonland is a super simple and super fun twin stick shooter (certanly one of my favorites) and I can easily recommend it to anyone looking for a fun and simple, yet challenging top down shooter.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989620359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 1830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 500, 'last_played': 1690140942}
review:
Played the shareware version of this game ALOT back in 2003-2005, happy to buy it now on steam.

It's a great twin-stick shooter, that's very addicting because of the power-ups and weapon combinations which randomly spawn while playing the game. Survival mode is where the real action takes place. I remember constantly trying to get the highest possible scores on the old leaderbord back in the day. It was awesome & glorious.

Only 2 complaints: I liked the old UI waaay better. This is a cheap UI for mobile phones. The old one was more optimised for playing with a mouse. And in the old version you could wait to take the new perk, you just manually clicked the right mouse button for the menu to appear. Which was in some cases handy, now it automatically appears, sometimes in the middle of a difficult situation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198209895819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1517053807}
review:
- The campaign, on normal difficulty, lasts 2-3 hours depends on your skill.  
- No bug or glitch found. Controller works well (tested with a wired 360 controller).
- The game is straightforward. Shoot, reload, pick up a new gun, shoot, level up, choose a perk, shoot.
- Lots of guns and perks. Different guns feel different. When you gain a new perk, you can feel it. 
- After you finish the campaign, there's nothing more to unlock. You've seen all the perks and tried all the guns. What's left is the survival mode with some variety in game rules. 
- There could have been more map backgrounds.

Conclusion:
Fun game to play for a few hours. Recommend on deep sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985727392', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 1415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1642833890}
review:
"Oh, wow!" I thought, when a remastered version of Crimsonland came up on my queue. That brought back some memories.

*** Me speaking with a college friend, circa 2005 ***

Me: I've been spending a lot of time on this great shooter called Crimsonland.

Him: Oh yeah, I'm familiar with it.

Me: Have you played it? I've got a cracked copy I can give you.

Him: .....no thanks. I do QA for the company that publishes it. Please don't pirate our games.

Me: .....oh.....

*** FIN ***

Lots of memories.

I highly recommend you buy Crimsonland, in part because it's a simple and delightful shoot em' up for a great price, but mostly because I have a karmic debt to Chris that I need to pay off.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030578491', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 1321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1321, 'last_played': 1505705782}
review:
Good introduction to the top-down shooter w/ RPG elements genre. Must have been great when first released (2003), but I think the game is a bit overrated nowadays. Nevertheless, it kept me entertained for over 20 hours as I completed all the achievements (although I see now that I'm missing one because of a recent update, so I may need to play it a bit more).

There's a few game I would recommend over this one, Nation Red and Versus Squad, namely, but I will be sure to check 10tons Ltd new game as well, Tesla vs Lovecraft.

http://store.steampowered.com/app/39800/Nation_Red/
http://store.steampowered.com/app/471330/VERSUS_SQUAD/
http://store.steampowered.com/app/636100/Tesla_vs_Lovecraft/

author: {'steamid': '76561198062696800', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 654, 'last_played': 1517087870}
review:
Get this, get it NOW! Its only a couple of quid and its one of the best top down shooters I've played.  Having just completed the "Grim" difficulty, I have to say I've had a literal blast.

There are loads of weapons and a shed-load of perks that you can combo together so there's a bit of strategy to it.  On some of the harder difficulties I did find that I was praying for certain perks to come up in order to get through.  However, respawning is so quick and the levels only last a couple of minutes (usually), dieing is not really a frustation.

A real gem of a game. If you're like me where you only get a few minutes to play, this is a good one to pick up and put down but you still feel like your making progress.

review: Co prawda zaliczyÅ‚em tylko 7 godzin w aktualnej wersji, ale zagraÅ‚em we wszystkich trybach i ukoÅ„czyÅ‚em kampaniÄ™ dwukrotnie. Gra idealnie nadaje siÄ™ na krÃ³tkie sesje do odstresowania lub po prostu zajÄ™cia siÄ™ czymÅ› podczas rozmowy telefonicznej. Ulepszona wersja klasycznego crimsonland sprzed ponad 10 lat. author: {'steamid': '76561198418549470', 'num_games_owned': 1157, 'num_reviews': 654, 'playtime_forever': 680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1607218066}
review: The endless kill spree is uninterrupted on ubuntu linux. Sometimes you just want some instant action and some feel-good gameplay. That is Crimsonland. Jump in, start shooting, grab a new weapon, shoot some more, make a daring grab for a powerful power-up, get a level-up perk, get surrounded and yet survive, level-up, level-up, and get totally surrounded and killed. Total time: six minutes. Crimsonland built itself off great gameplay, great enemy AI, and a fun concept. (Wish more titles started there!) On top of that is a short campaign mode that is required to unlock all the game components, and a high score board that can be used to compete with your friends. And, if just having a fun to play singleplayer game is not enough, then grab some friends for multi-player co-operative in different types of game modes. Crimsonland - despite being non-stop bloodbath - makes me hopeful for a bighter future, where indie developers use their limited resources for extremely polished and fun games. Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198067227433', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1577628252}
review:
Crimsonland look like yet another top-down arena wave-based twin-stick shooter. It is. But as it were free I tried it before dinner, and it was so fun I played for one hour and a half (growing hungry up to the point of quiting the game). Somehow the recipe works more than usual and you just get your delicious daily dose of twin-sticking shooting.

Pros:
+ Very fun.
+ Fast and forward.
+ A good diversity of weapons
+ The system of perks works very well and adds some real fun
+ Co-op looks juicy!
+ The difficulty seems to be just the right amount of challenge
+ You can restart a level several times, but each time you know you can beat it
+ Manage to add some variety between levels despite the barebones gameplay mechanics 
+ It takes less than 100Mb on your hard drive (less than a picture of a coffee!)

Cons:
- Achievements are not very bright
- Sometimes some levels are a bit luck-based (your survival chances relie a bit too much on the weapon you receive)
- You could shoot as well towards moving pellets or vegetables, you wouldn't quite notice the difference
- It remains a mindless barebones arena twin-stick shooter, after all...
- The music is sometimes quite bad
- Invisible walls of the arena so you get stuck without being able to anticipate it
- And the things at which you shoot, they can get through the wall, so you can die just because they were hidden off-screen behind the invisible walls
- Indecently overpriced out of sales. 4 bucks/pounds/euros should be your maximum buying price.

Verdict: On 80% sales with a free trial, it's a honest yes. You'll get your fun. It works well, and as we say in French, 'la sauce prend'. At full price, I'd say your money is easily better spent otherwise for there are much better games for the same price tag, and it's nothing more than a bland graphics mindless shotter with loop music and shapeless foes. Be warned, and enjoy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009849888', 'num_games_owned': 1249, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1692253694}
review:
It came out in 2003 so you'll have to give it a bit of a break when it comes to thing like complexity, graphics, music, etc.  But this is the top down shooter that influenced nearly every arcadey+RPG top down shooter to come after it.  People will tell you how certain other TDS' match up against Crimsonland solely because it's a perfected formula.

It's simple, extremely straightfoward, has plenty of unlockables, a little sense of humor.  It's a good game to play inbetween other games.  It's $2.80 at the time of writing which is a damn steal as I paid $20 for it 15 years ago, and I was happy to pay the $13 again back in 2014.

author: {'steamid': '76561198296949206', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 2339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1543, 'last_played': 1646415991}
review:
Finland does it again with insane high-intensity action at a sometimes unforgivably high pace
huge selection of grim futuristic weapons, impressive menagerie, numerous gameplay modes, but most of all: lots of fun
the only downside i can think of is how addictive this is, and i'm not just saying that; you can easily sink hours into what would've been a quick 15 minute sesh before bed

100 years ago, Finland gained their independence
but more than that: they gained the ability to blow our minds with kickass games
thank you, Finland
keep whipping em out

review: Este juego es un ejemplo de los desestresantes que pueden ser algunos juegos de Steam. El juego es muy simple, los enemigos salen por todos los lados y los tienes que matar como puedas. Tienes varios modos, 30 armas, 50 items con su jugabilidad, y allÃ¡ te las veas. El juego no tiene mucho, pero resulta muy entretenido y tiene homenajes (por no decir plagios) a otros juegos como se ve en la portada. Recomendable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062813911', 'num_games_owned': 1955, 'num_reviews': 2050, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1694491778}
review:
[h1] DISCLAIMER: This is a first impressions review, and NOT a full review 

PLEASE NOTE (2017): Due to recent false accusations of plagarism, I (the reviewer) would like to stress that all these reviews and upcoming reviews are original and are not blatantly copied. Other reviews are used to help stress my point across but are changed in such a way to make the review in my own wording [/h1]

Crimsonland is a game developed and published by 10tons Ltd. and reminds me of a top down version of Doom and you can clearly see that this game is inspired by said games

The game offers over six different campaigns all varying in gameplay styles and mechanics with three different difficulties and some hardcore bosses. Crimsonland has over seven bonus game modes and over 55 perks and roughly 30 weapons

The game offers local party mode which I couldn't try because I have no friends and of course, Crimsonland offers a lot of achievements and a ton of Steam trading cards!

The online downside to this game is that there is no online mode and it seems that 10tons Ltd. will not be implementing online mode which is a shame because it would have been fantastic especially for people who have no friends...

Crimsonland is a bloody good game to try out and play in short bursts!

[h1] RECOMMENDED :) [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198100910014', 'num_games_owned': 1611, 'num_reviews': 366, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1689371122}
review:
Hola buenas noches he aprovechado la oferta de la franquicia
de juegos finlandeses y me he encontrado con esta joyita que
tanto tiempo queria aÃ±adir a mi humilde bibllioteca,estan
desarrollando otro juego del mismo estilo.

Crimsonland es un juego que pertenece al gÃ©nero top down
shooter,es decir,un juego de disparos con vista isometrica o
cenital.

Creo que es una de las mejores apuestas que hay publicadas
en Steam actualmente,se que existen muchos mÃ¡s,por ejemplo
destacqarÃ­a la saga Alien breed que fue lanzado tanto en PC
como en consolas domesticas.

La historia sobre este juego no esta explicada en ninguna parte
es pura jugabilidad,nos desplazaremos por varios menÃºs que
son bastante intuitivos,una gozada vamos.

Encontramos dos modos de juego diferenciados por un lado,
la campaÃ±a que esta formada por unos nueve niveles mas o
menos que se desglosan en otros nueve,de manera que
de manera total existen 81 niveles.

Cada nivel de capitulo cuenta con un epigafre o sentencia,
una pequeÃ±a descripcion para que nos entendamos que
me parece muy clave y necesaria.

Ademas en cada uno contaremos con una barra en la
parte superiror de progreso para aclararnos en que
punto concreto estamos.

Durante cada nivel iremos desbloqueando nuevas
armas para utilizarlas en el siguiente,al subir un
nivel nuestro personaje nos daran a elegir entre
diferentes privelegios que nos ayudaran.

Por otro lado los power-ups o potenciadores
nos haran las cosas mas sencillas.

Existen tres niveles de dificultad y un modo
adicional llamado supervivencia o modo
horda.

Un juego muy recomendado que cuenta con

author: {'steamid': '76561198040870621', 'num_games_owned': 387, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1455128157}
review:
The game has changed since I played it for the first time. But still, there is one simple idea behind the gameplay - kil l'em all.
This game is a simple top-down shooter, that gave me hours of good play. 
A set of weapons mixed with system of perks will give you tones of possibilities to anihilate alien swarms.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045803933', 'num_games_owned': 2116, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1048, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 948, 'last_played': 1586546702}
review:
I came across this game years and years ago and liked the simple premise of it. When the updated version got out on Steam I bought it and was pleasantly surprised at the added modes, unlockable difficulties, unlockable weapons with funny descriptions and more stuff like that.
So, if you want a simple top-down shoot-em-up, I recommend this one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198022419533', 'num_games_owned': 984, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1013, 'last_played': 1693790002}
review:
A classic top-down slaughter survival and kill 'em all shooter, with unique guns and perks to help you survive against the onslaught of incoming enemies. It has seamless (twin stick) controller support with local 4 player multiplayer. You can't put it down and find yourself continuing through the missions, completing each round unlocking the next level of difficulty, or attempting to stay alive as long as you inevitably can't.

The various game modes keep the game's replayability going. Crimsonland is a blast!

author: {'steamid': '76561197984250713', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1545, 'last_played': 1629742546}
review:
I bought this game from their website, way back when. When I saw it on Steam, I figured it'd be a good way to play again, since I'd switched computers since that time.

It reminds me a lot of the original Fallout with its Perks, but if Fallout was a non-stop action game instead of an RPG wasteland.

Good to waste time, but no story to speak of, so have fun blasting endless waves of aliens.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993601861', 'num_games_owned': 1374, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1037, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 795, 'last_played': 1584635208}
review:
Flashy graphics? Not really.
Deep story? Ermmmm.
Amazing music? Well, that depends on who you ask.
Loads of aliens? Indeed.
Barrels of bullets? Check.
Perks? That's a yes.
Should you play this when you get home from work but you're not really sure what you're doing in front of the computer? ABSOLUTELY.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076467154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 865, 'last_played': 1513148513}
review:
Este juego es muy bueno para pasar el rato. 
Los niveles son reducidos, lo cual es bueno para este juego, pues solo haces una cosa: matar aliens, lo se le da muy bien.
Tiene un gran nÃºmero de armas y potenciadores desbloqueables y ningÃºn juego es igual. Los controles son precisos y las grÃ¡ficas, aunque simples, cumplen su propÃ³sito, pues aun con la pantalla llena de enemigos puedes identificar con claridad que hace cada uno. 
Lo malo es que los potenciadores y las armas son completamente al azar, por lo que hace que algunas partidas seas la muerte cabalgando y otras un trozo de carnada.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136082532', 'num_games_owned': 360, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1511131133}
review:
ADDICTED!!!

I've found it really hard to really get in to games recently (maybe due to becoming a dad again a few weeks ago), but I'm proper in to this game at the moment.  It's so intense!  Having hoards of monsters coming towards you, with no apparent way of escaping, then BOOM, you get a banging new gun or hit a nuke and absolutely bosh everyone around you.  What a feeling!

Totally recommend this game.  Great for those times when you only have 20mins to play something.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022827315', 'num_games_owned': 738, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1432, 'last_played': 1595833745}
review:
[h1] One of the best Twin-Stick Shooters out there [/h1]
 
 
Crimsonland really was a pleasant surprise to me. This type of game normally will not hold my attention long, but this, after 20 hours and every achievement its still got my attention.
 
Although the question is, will you love Crimsonland? Let discuss some of the features the game offers.
 
 
[list]
[*][b][u]Graphics[/u]-[/b] So the Steam version of Crimsonland is the remade version of the 2003 game of the same name. As you would expect the graphics did improve, a pretty decent graphic jump it seems.
 

[*][b][u]Gameplay[/u]-[/b] The game is all about surviving the infinite hordes of aliens, zombies, lizards, and giant spiders. That is exactly what you do. Although it is not quite that simple there is six different types of gamemodes including quest mode. You can even team up with 3 of your friends in four player co-op, sadly it is only local co-op though. Here is a clip of some gameplay of the Survival gamemode. Take a look and see what you think. https://youtu.be/kGBCdXIgCnI 
 

[*][b][u]Combat[/u]-[/b] Like I mentioned above Crimsonland is all about surviving against infinite hordes of enemies. You would think that would get stale FAST, but it doesn't. You get armed to the eyeball with 30 different weapons and 55 crazy perks! You do have to unlock them of course but that is easy enough, plus that gives you a chance to play with all the new stuff.
 

[*][b][u]AI[/u]-[/b] In a Twin-Stick Shooter like this you would pretty much expect a follow or chase type of AI. Well that is what you get, but it's not quite that simple. You don't get to just kite everyone around like you can in some of these types of games. Some of the enemies will just follow you around  while some will figure out how to take a shortcut and catch up to you.

 
[*][b][u]Story[/u]-[/b] Like I mentioned in the gameplay section there is a quest mode, and that is the closest to a story you are going to get. To be honest it is NOT a story it is just 60 missions of increasing complexity. Although when you play it on any of the three difficulties they will be different enough to keep it fresh.


[*][b][u]Replayability[/u]-[/b] Crimsonland is one of the rare titles that will probably always stay installed and ready to play in my library. The five alternate game modes offer such a variety of experiences that it will always keep me coming back. Even the most basic survival mode is nearly endless fun trying to always improve your high score and try new weapons and perks.
 

[*][b][u]Value for Dollar[/u]-[/b] I think the pricing is pretty spot on here. The game is simple enough that anyone can get into it yet complex enough to keep long term players around. If you aren't necessarily into Twin-Stick Shooters or never played the 2003 version, you might wish to wait for a sale, but if you made it this far into this review I think it'll be worth it for you.


[*][b][u]What Would I do Different or add?[/u]-[/b] Anyone who has read some of my other reviews will know I love detailed statistics, I think Crimsonland could have really benefited from that. I would have really loved to have known how many total enemies I have killed, what my favorite weapon and perk is, Etc. Etc. The only other thing I would have changed is the local co-op, I would have liked for this to be online, but I understand why it is not.


[*][b][u]Author Notes[/u]-[/b]
This review is solely based on the 2014 version of Crimsonland not the 2003 version.

If you have any questions or comments concerning the game or my review do not hesitate to ask!

review: "Crimsonland" is back! Those who used to play the 2003 year version will likely be pleased just as I am. It has all the great stuff the original had: blood, gore, slaughter, the perk system and a its black humor. And even if you haven't played the original you should definitely try it if you're into some badass shootin' with RPG elements.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964867567', 'num_games_owned': 259, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1961, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1760, 'last_played': 1637265487}
review:
Some days, I want complex gameplay and the satisfaction of mastering complicated, intricate systems. Other days, I'm looking for engaging stories with memorable characters in thought-provoking settings.

But some days, I just want to blow away tons of aliens with interesting weapons and see if I can finally beat my high score. And when that urge strikes, I keep coming back to Crimsonland -- Steam tells me I've put over 28 hours into this game already, in 5-15 minute bursts. It's a great arcade shooter with an addictive appeal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019159426', 'num_games_owned': 1871, 'num_reviews': 433, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1676116248}
review:
played this game back in the day - pirate- Supporting 10tons development now. Amazing game. Understatement. It's quick to play. nice destress; I wish i could carry this and install on any pc possible; but work will crack a tea pot hahaha - 
Typo Shooter is my favourite. A real challenge with the keyboard only; Unique, Dick Zeta, lol many variations of common words that you just can't type fast enough to keep killing.
Since 2003- 10tons has refined this game into a stage where it will last forever. This game is small, but full of many adventures for any age/
can even play the classic 2003 version IF YOU WANT :) comes with steam, Nice heavy rock soundtrack - 
ToNNES of aliens to kill :D
HIGHLY RECOMMENDED:

author: {'steamid': '76561198025017513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 866, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 524, 'last_played': 1665444312}
review:
I recall Playing this, only had the Demo as a Kid way back in the day, repeatedly with Friends

I am Happy that there have been many improvements and updates to this Classic

Hours and hours have been Enjoyed by me on the PS4 version of Crimsonland, but I like that the Steam/PC version of it includes the Original Game as well as a few other extras, plus the ability to be made Easier or Harder, depending on what Options you choose

Looking forward to Sharing this with Friends and painting the Lands Crimson!

author: {'steamid': '76561198029415055', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 777, 'last_played': 1619565816}
review: A wicked top down shooter, very easy to play with controller and KB+M (recommend the latter). One of the few games I can pick up and play. Its simplistic and does what it sets out to do very well, killing hordes of enemies. Would not recommend at full price but 100% worth a sale pick up.
