author: {'steamid': '76561198044116231', 'num_games_owned': 517, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 2208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2208, 'last_played': 1691996471}
review:
The simple things in life often brings the most joy and Crimsonland is no exception to that!

[b]New Players:[/b]
Crimsonland is a top-down wave survivor where you play as a lone marine ([i]or 4 if you have friends[/i]), who tries to survive against hordes of aliens, zombies, bugs, spiders and more for the ultimate score.

[b]Review:[/b]
From a content perspective, this game is pretty bare-bones. There isn't a story, just chapters you progress through doing the same as you did before, which is killing stuff, discovering new perks and weapons. You can beat this game on normal within 2 hours and then get to the real fun and action which is hard difficulty and survival.

Out of all the wave shooters, I have to say that this one has aged really well, especially because of updates to make it look and run better. I spent hours playing this game a few years ago and starting it up again feels as satisfying as I remember.

There aren't any negatives for me to point out. Don't expect too much of this game, it's really just a simple, fun time-waster, but it does go to show that games don't have to have the most beautiful, exotic graphics, most compelling story or bestest-best game play to be a fun experience.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198006555408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 1640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 876, 'last_played': 1702332727}
review:
Good old game, brings back memories.
repetitive, yes 
hard, yes 
worth full price, not a chance. I got this game on sale for 2$ or 3$ and I'd suggest it if you see it for 5$ or less
still an nice little game if you have 10-15 minutes to spare at a time

author: {'steamid': '76561198006943503', 'num_games_owned': 2297, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1079, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 650, 'last_played': 1490342525}
review:
An excellent arena shooter. With multiple difficulty levels, lots of perks to unlock and choose from, varying game modes, and leaderboards to compete on, Crimsonland is good for many hours of fun killing aliens, zombies, and spiders.

Since the recent update, this version of the game also includes the old 2003 version (which has somewhat different mechanics) as a free bonus, which is great for anyone who is nostalgic for the old game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046111769', 'num_games_owned': 969, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 2489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 7, 'playtime_at_review': 1713, 'last_played': 1711331174}
review:
It's fun with the Steam Controller. It runs on my old X301 that I keep for browsing and watching movies. It's fun. And I'm going to get my wife to join in, because it's got local co-op. So, yeah, Worth it. I mean, I did get it during the Summer Sale, but it looked worth a shot, so I actually downloaded it, and yeah, good times.

So, to update. 

My wife and I have done the "just one more round" thing with this game for two hours, and really cut into sleep, because we're very adultlike people. 

It's fun. 

But screw the Spideroids level on hardcore. Eesh. Those little snots are... tenacious.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152760885', 'num_games_owned': 17515, 'num_reviews': 481, 'playtime_forever': 397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1467896778}
review:
[h1]Basic Information[/h1]
[b]Title:[/b]  Crimsonland
[b]Developer:[/b]  10tons Ltd.
[b]Publisher:[/b]  10tons Ltd.
[b]Genre:[/b]  Top-down Shooter

[h1]General Impression[/h1]
Crimsonland is a 2014 reboot of a very good arcade game released 11 years prior. The top-down shooting mechanics are complemented by pleasant graphics and a surprisingly large arsenal. So you will never complain that this title got boring fast. It actually provides enough fun and diversity, that even its â€œstory modeâ€ is enjoyable. The titular sanguinary gore is as always, a sight to behold. The only flaw I could find to this game, is the difficulty which scales wildly and can push towards rage quitting even a Buddhist monk.  Throw in a co-op mode plus a complex perk system and you have yourself one of the best top-down shooters in recent memory. 

[h1]Strong Points[/h1]
+ Interesting graphics and gameplay mechanics.
+ Steam Trading Cards & Achievements.

[h1]Weak Points[/h1]
- Unbalanced difficulty.

[b]Rating 8/10[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198074098926', 'num_games_owned': 1173, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2083, 'last_played': 1587675621}
review:
If you played the original Crimsonland, you should play this. If you did not, you should still play this!

Top-down shooter with main quest mode and several other game modes (including one hidden game mode). Multiple weapons to choose from, various powerups, and a roguelike element of levelling and 'perks' - playthroughs of levels are very short, so can be played even if you only have a few minutes to spare (as opposed to dedicating several hours just to progress, like some other games).

Only downside is that if you want to play multiplayer, its local co-op,
Would be 10/10 if included steam-based multiplayer. (*cough* developers, I'm talking to you)

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198041831806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 719, 'last_played': 1682874869}
review:
In this sale, I bought a lot of old games just for the awesome developers who made my childhood great. I couldn't skip Crimsonland of course and 10tons surprised me. I didn't know before I bought it but you can play 2014 AND 2003 versions of Crimsonland by buying the 2014 version. Because of this, I still couldn't start the 2014 version.

I started 2014 version and noticed one huge thing was missing: Ice ground in the chapter 4. Turning the white floor to red by spilling blood like there's no tomorrow was a pretty good thing about this game. I wish they still had it but 2014 version is still very much recommendable nonetheless.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970739339', 'num_games_owned': 676, 'num_reviews': 564, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1466363031}
review: Crimsonland is a zero-bullshit top-down shooter with no plot and no waiting, just you, a bunch of guns and perks, and a metric shitload of aliens, zombies, lizardmen, bugs and spiders trying to eat your face. I heard it compared at least once to Smash TV, and that's probably the best comparison. Run, shoot, reload, pick up some powerups like smart bombs, incendiary rounds, bullet time and arcing electrical blasts, and hopefully not die. There's a lengthy quest mode, as well as a bunch of survival modes, all of which have up to four player, same-screen local coop, a rarity for PC games. The graphics are minimal but sufficient, and the music is completely appropriate cheesy buttrock. A great party game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971480281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 968, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 570, 'last_played': 1607196850}

review:

Great fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561197966468894', 'num_games_owned': 819, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 1175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 969, 'last_played': 1691540306}
review:
Meta review: Every time I play this game I think of something new bad to say about it.

I first got hip to CL 4-5 versions ago and the devs have basically made it worse every single one.

Because of the new leveling system, this new steam edition is more RNG-based than ever.

When devs screw their own game up so much every time they revise it, you wonder "did they even know what they did right in the first place?"

There are enough twin stick shooters in the world nowadays that you don't really have to bother with this one.

(I'll try to put some time in on Nation Red sometime soon and if I can think of anything that game /doesn't/ do better, I'll post back. :P)

author: {'steamid': '76561197960393604', 'num_games_owned': 2763, 'num_reviews': 243, 'playtime_forever': 546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 516, 'last_played': 1463019130}
review:
Every bit as fun as the old tech demo I loved ten years ago.  Now in a new and improved form.  Lots of action, lots of guns, lots of enemies, lots of blood on the sand, Crimsonland is a wonderful top-down shooter in the old "Smash TV" play style.  Waves of enemies trying to overrun your defenses.

Obviously this game has changed a lot since the early versions.  New game mode, different enemies, more weapons, perks, etc. have only enhanced the experience for me.  There's a lot to do.  My biggest complaint would be that the four-player multi-player is local co-op only.  Given that this version is on the Steam platform, it would be amazing if you could hook up with players on your friends list to really go at it.

That doesn't make the single player any less exciting however.  There's a lot of things to unlock through the missions (and they appear to have added leveling to the missions, unlike when I was playing it on Steam earlier, which does make the missions a lot more fun as well), as well as several extra modes to choose from.

The price IS a bit high for my liking.  I'd probably recommend it more when it goes on sale.  If you do get a chance to pick it up them, don't let it pass you by!

author: {'steamid': '76561198133910393', 'num_games_owned': 991, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 3446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2054, 'last_played': 1697712249}
review:
An intense fast paced, top down, shooter. It has loads of weapons, upgrades, levels, and gamemodes to unlock. There are 3 different difficulties to play through, with a large variety of enemies.

All in all, an excellent game to play for any period of time.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197991777595', 'num_games_owned': 692, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 1387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1183, 'last_played': 1470071974}
review:
great fun for the price. Very Nice top down shooter. It was a positive surprise for me.
-fast
-addictive
- always something new at the end of each level.
- great selection of guns and power ups.
- challenging
- runs great on dual core 1.6ghz and an old laptop Nvidia GPU.
- xbox one controller support.
- 4 players co-op.

The developers deserve your money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011733834', 'num_games_owned': 820, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1704776298}
review:
Solid little twin stick shooter, where the guns and power up you use each time are mostly RNG dependent. The campaign content is balanced so that it isn't entirely luck based, because the guns and power ups that eventually spawn are extremely good and you will be able to mow down 100s of mobs easily. The perks can also get super crazy the more you stack. This game is fun because no two runs will be exactly the same. Each level or survival run will reset your character's progression, so you will level up and choose new perks within each run.

You may cringe at the RNG aspect, but it won't seriously screw you over until survival. In survival modes, a power up or gun may spawn behind a sea of mobs, and because getting hit by mobs slows you down and their pathing is design to swarm and overwhelm you, you will not be able to make it.

I got this game years ago. Even now, I can't say this is worth shelling out 14 bucks for. It has a lot of content; chiefly a 70 level campaign that will admittedly go very fast, with 3 tiers of difficulty. There are a couple survival modes with different rules and leaderboards as well. There is a lot of replayability as well as many different guns and perks. HOWEVER, its not a super pretty game, and it is very repetitive to the point of monotony. it is far better, like most games with multiplayer support, with friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198203407209', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 646, 'last_played': 1658885700}
review: An old, but still incredibly fun twin stick shooter. My only problem is that on hard mode, the difficulty seems to ramp up for reasons that don't really seem fair. I mean, there's only so many ways you can make the simple premise of "run around a 2D arena shooting things" much harder, but still, it just gets cheap at some points and deaths don't feel earned.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053924905', 'num_games_owned': 3907, 'num_reviews': 374, 'playtime_forever': 417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1418349226}

author: {'steamid': '76561197963550511', 'num_games_owned': 26596, 'num_reviews': 272, 'playtime_forever': 869, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1604950235}
review:
[b]Updated and definitely more majestic rÃ«vjÃº[/b]
Crimsonland, now [u]actually Crimsonland[/u], with perks in Quest Mode! \o/

Once upon a time, before we had Nation Red, the jolliest "run around topdown and kill stuff" video game known to humanity was Crimsonland. Then came Steam, and it brought with it Nation Red in 2009, and it was jolly, but what truly would have been jollier... Crimsonland.

Fast-forward to the year 2014, and our cries were heard. The [i]Lord GabeN[/i] (or rather the dreadful Greenlight system) brought us Crimsonland on Steam. However, as you can read below, not everything was well in this newfound land of milk and honey... it wasn't the Crimsonland we wanted, nor was it the Crimsonland we deserved. It wasn't even the Crimsonland we needed. In this limbo we suffered, admittedly with enough other games to play in the meantime.

With a bang, March 2016 brought with it much-needed game design adjustments, as well as the free addition of 2003's Crimsonland. All the inhabitants of Earth rejoiced, and a time of serenity arrived, such as was not known to them before. And [i]10tons[/i] did this mighty act, that there might be no more evil upon Earth. Now go forth and play this game, dear reader, so that all the alien opponents in it get turned about like pottage in a cauldron. And die. Make sure they die.


P.S.: Online coop, please? Please? PLEASE?!


-------
Previous June 28, 2014 review; [b]FOR HISTORICAL PURPOSES ONLY[/b]
-------

First of all, let me say that indeed the quest mode is LESS JOLLY than it was in the original game. There's no perks there so it's way more of a boring grind than it needs to be. Also, the way the game handles 'reference resolutions' and whatnot is pretty odd.

However, there's still arousing Crimsonland gameplay to be found in this 'HD' upgrade.

P.S.: http://store.steampowered.com/app/39800/ is damn good, play it.

P.P.S.: Online coop, please? Please?

author: {'steamid': '76561198120398414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2077, 'last_played': 1556917837}
review:
A game which you will always come back to.

  I remember playing Crimsonland on my windows xp back in the day, and found the game to be a great time killer between my study periods. This game is an absoulte classic in my opinion. I found this game to be amazing when i was younger, and it still is to a certain degree.

  This is a game that you won't be addicted to, but you won't ever get tried of the gameplay (survival mode is a hella fun). If you are short on time and want to spend a few minutes gaming, then this game is a must.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994849273', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 1583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1567, 'last_played': 1518037008}
review:
UPDATE: the game has been made quite easier since I played, so disergard the negative comment about the spiderdroid level.

Beside being a nice twin stick shooter with balancing issues, Crimsonland is first and foremost a serious statement about the opportunity of ripping audio samples out of pornographic material.

Seriously, the player's death screams (plural, as they made more than one!): they would make John Holms blush! After 20 times of hearing your character "deeply enjoying" his death, you become a master of "Esc pressing and restarting", just to avoid that part.

Putting the more erotic aspects of the game aside, it's a very enjoyable shooter with a lot of replayability, coop mode, and a number of modes. It doesn't properly "shine" in anything, but everything is from adequate (music, graphics) to very good (gameplay, weapons).

The only major complaint that takes the 5th star out of the title, is balancing: there is one single level that literally *ruins* the game (2.10, Spiderdroids) and is so difficult, that finishing it in normal mode is more difficult than all other levels on all difficulty settings combined (and let's not even speak about the possibility of getting the "no scratch" achievement...). 

Very recommended, especially for the price tag.

OOooouuuuuaaaarrrrhhhhggghhhhhhhhh....aaaaahhh.... I'm dead.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990754897', 'num_games_owned': 567, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1466, 'last_played': 1589032738}
review: A cult classic. The remake has a couple quality of life improvements here and there, but overall this is still the good old Crimsonland where the goal is to kill and not be killed by hordes of enemies. Easy to grasp, hard to perfect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097717989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1193, 'last_played': 1616430210}

author: {'steamid': '76561198030589833', 'num_games_owned': 678, 'num_reviews': 220, 'playtime_forever': 686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1461075026}
review:
This is a short, simple and straightforward 360 shooter, where you are tasked with eliminating swarms of lizards, monsters and a variety of bugs with a fantastically varied arsenal of weaponary and special powers. It has that "just one more go" thing about it.

My only bugbear is that the game seems to get easier as you progress into the later levels, which dilutes the satisfaction of completing the game. No matter though, it's still great fun. The developers seem like a great bunch, as evidenced by their generous inclusion of new features into the game that they could have sold as DLC. Look forward to what they have to offer next. 

A nice little indie gem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002495368', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1469623725}

author: {'steamid': '76561198082243547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1655664558}
review:
I'm a fan of the Crimsonland since I tried the demo version 13 years ago - since nowdays I remembered that game and it is not a coincidance.

Fast-paced action, simple gameplay yet with a very high fun-factor. The quest survival mode guarantees hours of fun; it's great to demolish the alien hordes aftert a wearing day.

The new release is not only a common HD remake, but has some really good content: The new perks are exciting and the weapons are great too.

To sum up, I absolutely recommend this game to everyone; on PC and on phone/tablet too.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998209121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1647249704}
review: For me is the best top-down shooter in the world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055079941', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1478358845}
review:
I've only played a minute and I already know I like it.

It's one of those games where the movements and commands are so smooth that you would still play, at least for a bit, even if there were no enemies and no challenge - just exploration. The core mechanics are well done.
Now add guns, shooting still feels super smooth. Then add enemies and you get a great game.

Good for laptops too by the way, easy to run.

I'm not a "graphics are so important!" type of guy but the graphics look great and really help with immersing you in the game. Sound effects as well. Animations are smooth

I love those types of top down shooters but there aren't many that are good. This one is very good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036459616', 'num_games_owned': 612, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 773, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1593972514}
review:
Bought this game on sale for less than $4.00.  I'm always looking for local multiplayer / co-op games that me and my friends can play together.  This one did NOT disappoint.  It reminds me of my younger days when I would play Smash TV at the local arcade (years later on the SNES...) and how much fun that game was.  This, simply put, is a great game to fire up and waste some time blowing through hordes of aliens, lizards, spiders, etc.  It has that constant 'just one more round' problem, which makes it nearly impossible for you to put the controller down.  (Many times I have to force myself to stop playing.)

I haven't had a chance to play with any friends, yet, but just the solo mode has been a lot of fun.  Enough weapons and perks to keep things interesting and not being 'stale and repetitive' and when you think a level is to hard for you, you mange to get a good score of some decent weapons and power-ups to power through.  Not too hard, but not a simple cake walk either.  I've only done the quest mode so far, so I know there are more modes of fun to be had with with survival.

Get this one when it is on sale.  It is definitely worth the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018453161', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 17449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17351, 'last_played': 1517064427}
review:
As a former top 10 player, in most game modes, I used to play this game a lot.
After their (10tons) new release being compared so much to Crimsonland, I have no hope for a second rendition.
And after being ignored and told to shut up, I'm done entirely.

Have fun. I won't reign over the leaderboards anymore ^.^

author: {'steamid': '76561197990234619', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1458321513}
review:
Restarting a quest level 1000 times, just to get the one gun with which you have a snowballs chance in hell of getting through the level without taking a hit: priceless.

Extra bonus: think you're getting through a level when you've got a great weapon? Nope, an enemy spawns on your location and instantly hits you, nullifying your perfect round. Now throw a coin to decide whether to restart the round or finally just uninstall the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027872398', 'num_games_owned': 1350, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1715, 'last_played': 1518372671}
review: I wasn't the biggest fan of this remake, since it was pretty lackluster in comparison to the much superior classic version from 2003. Luckily, this isn't the case anymore, because the developer of the game actually listened to the fans, brought back the missing game mode (Typ'o'shooter!), changed back the game mechanics and even included the classic version of the game for free. Now I can finally, without hesitation recommend Crimsonland as a must play twin stick shooter!

author: {'steamid': '76561198008873552', 'num_games_owned': 641, 'num_reviews': 174, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1440242409}
review:
I loved this game so much in it's own age, and I was very glad to see it making a return on steam, but even if unrealisticly overpriced, it's the type of game you can wait any long time for to go on sale. As part of a Humble Bundle pack I did not regret buying it, however I sadly cannot honestly recommend buying it on PC, for 3 reasons.

1. This isn't the game we loved back then. It has an awful new gigantic UI and "click in the corner for a new player to join", making it very clear they relased the android port on PC instead of simply re-relasing the old client with added compatibility. Sadly, much of the nostalgia factor is killed off because of it.

2. The game didn't age very well, on it's own and relatively to the rest of the market. We just passed or may still live in years where mass wave survival shooters are getting relased every week, and among them Crimsonland simply cannot stand, for it's extremely cheap looking and while undoubtedly fun but very unimaginative and boring powerups and weapons just doesn't offer anything that could make it stand out and say - buy me over this or that, because... ?

3. The price. It's unreasonably high for a game that is about 15 year old, and adds nothing to the original other than an uncomfortibly huge UI and steam achievements.

However, as I mentioned I picked up the game in Humble Bundle, and it also came with it's android version. I played that a LOT. I mean, a LOT. I remember spending days, added together easily weeks at work (yeah... well, we had nothing to do for hours a day quite often those times...) and having so much fun with it. The touchscreen controls and the higher difficulty levels together really create an extremely challanging gameplay and obviously the new UI is designed to work well there.

Pick up the android version, and just remember the old PC version as something you had fun with as a kid, and let it be remembered that way instead of ruining it with this new PC version. If you haven't played it, ever, still recommended for phones / tablets, but you are better off spending your money on a similar but better arena survival game on PC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030080447', 'num_games_owned': 1277, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 1118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1118, 'last_played': 1457772279}
review:
[b]Crimsonland[/b] is a fast-paced, very well thought-off and balanced top-down shooter. The game is clearly based on the classic with the same name from 2003 - with the most recent major update, the original game is even presented for free when you buy [b]Crimsonland[/b] on Steam. Just as the original one, the new version is a no-nonsense game in which you get several different gamemodes which offer access to just the one thing that really counts: slaying monsters, aliens and zombies. And there are a TON of those, so you need some decent gear, don't you? Happily, [b]Crimsonland[/b] offers exactly that: the number of weapons isn't overwhelmingly large, but they are very different from each other and most ask for an appropriate playstyle to make the most of them. You'd better stay out of the melee with the Ion Cannon and take on the mob from a distance, but a flamethrower just wants you to get in there are clear a small ring of safety around you.

Thankfully, 10TonsLtd have also included a fairly large number of power-ups which appear during the fights and which come in most welcome when the crowds get bigger and bigger. Make no mistake: this is no easy-going game, and the going gets really tough towards the end of the different scenario's. Happily that's where the dozens of available perks come in: they offer a permanent of way of buffing your character, and allow for some degree of ever so slight character building, especially with regard to a playstyle which suits you best.

Graphically, the game gets the job done, but not more than that. Some extra effort and more visual appeal would have been welcome. Sound is pretty good though, with all weapons having a very clear identity of their own. Steam cards and a bunch of interesting - and some quite difficult - achievements make sure this game offers quite some playtime.

[b]Recommended, even more so for everyone who fancies taking out the enemy hords from above[/b]

review:
ok now that the Typo Shooter has been added to the game I will give it a thumbs up.

The classic Crimsonland shooting is done great and much better. However Typo Shooter is very inferior to the original... the camera is closer and monster move way much faster.

If you want the real Typo Shooter experience that made this game legendary, install the Classic version, thank god they added it to Steam version (it wasnt available from the start)

author: {'steamid': '76561198022728853', 'num_games_owned': 835, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 499, 'last_played': 1593758752}
review: I played this game back in 2003 when it was originally released and for me it was an instant favorite.  I had forgotten about it until I picked it up on GOG when the HD remaster was released and it's been my goto de-stressing game ever since.  I picked it up on Steam a couple months ago as part of a bundle and I've been having lots of fun playing it on the go.  This game is a pretty basic top down shooter with in-game powerups and weapons.  The game gets pretty challenging as the hardness level increases,  but for most it shouldn't be too hard to get 3 stars on each of the missions on normal play.    I definitely recommend this game for anyone that likes a run, shoot, don't think too much type of game.  The monsters offer a nice variety of challenge.  The spiders add plenty of creepiness factor.  Definitely worth a sale price purchase of around $5 or less.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992971887', 'num_games_owned': 819, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2085, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 706, 'last_played': 1706576099}
review:
Recommended but buy it on offer. I finally purchased the original non-steam version of this in 2011, although I first played it back in 2002. It really is a great game, but nothing much has changed since the 2011 version, which cost me just under 6 quid. As with all games that make a move to steam, I also feel cheated I have to buy it again for the updates. The download link for the original installer I have no longer works. 

Fortunately I do still have the original installer on a backup drive, but I would feel seriously annoyed if I didn't and couldn't download a product I already paid for. It simply isn't worth the current asking price, although I'm sure the engine changes took some time to implement.

review:
This oldschool classic is a quite lovely twinstick shooter filled with blood, monsters, levelups, perks and guns, gunsm guns, enemies, spiders, and buckets of blood.

The music is lovely and the game is a really quite nice game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198180812659', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 957, 'last_played': 1672419430}
review:
A great follow-up to the 2003 classic - be sure to opt into its beta (Apart from automatically enabling perks in quest mode it has the original Crimsonland and a type-shooter too) - or if you don't want to for whatever reason during gameplay press ESC and in the pause menu type GRIM and enable perks during quests.
To become perfect all it needs is online CO-OP. (It has only local CO-OP though which is great)
Solid 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197992257920', 'num_games_owned': 484, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1685932878}
review: Got this in a bundle, and immediately remembered playing it a few years back. It's still quite a lot of fun for such a simple game, more fun mechanically than many other games in its Smash TV type subgenre. I don't know that I'd pay the full Steam price for it, as it seems maybe a little steep, but if you see it in a sale or in a bundle, I'd say grab it, you can waste a good few mindless hours with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060545430', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 617, 'last_played': 1603263752}
review:
Changing my review to positive because they deserve it.

When this game was re-released on Steam, it was missing a lot of things that vets would be expecting to see there, like the perks in quest mode and the functionality of perks in survival mode. Some were removed entirely. The developer has added perks back into quest mode with their original functionalities. You can also opt into the beta client to test out other new perks before they make it into the final build. The UI and HUD still feels like a mobile game but whatever.

I don't know what made them think those changes would be improvements in the first place, but I'm glad that they listened to community feedback and changed things back to how they use to be. If you somehow are still not happy with the new graphics and all that with the original gameplay, you can also play the original Crimsonland that's included in this purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995949208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1503415104}
review:
The game was perfect back in its 2003 release, now it is ruined by unnecessary balancing to weapons, powerups and perks as well as removal of perks from Quest mode. The stages are now marked with a star when completed without taking hits, but the game was not at all balanced to that and it requires tremendous amount of luck to perform in later stages, making the lives of the completionists amongst us extremely miserable.

As the old saying goes, if it ain't broke, don't fix it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969480398', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1625078767}
review:
If you're like me and loved the original Crimsonland (from 2002), then I would NOT recommend this game. Sadly, it is nothing more than a watered down version of the old game. Several key features that made the game great are now missing.

- No perks in quest mode. This is HUGE! For some reason 10tons removed perks from main campaign mode. Which basically took all the fun out of the core gameplay. 
- No weapon switching. You are now only able to have one weapon at a time, which not only limits your fun, but also your ability to win.
- No choosing when to take your next perk. There used to be a button for leveling up, which was very handy. It is now gone and instead the player simply levels up immediately via a pop-up menu. Not only does this detract from the overall strategy of the game, but it's also horribly disruptive. It will cause you to lose focus on the action, make mistakes, or even worse: accidentally pick the wrong perk. Because you have only one second to stop clicking before the perk menu pops up, you risk clicking on a random perk if you don't stop shooting. 
- No timer on powerups. It's a small thing, but again, it takes away from the subtle strategy of the game. There used to be a small timer for each individual powerup off to the side of the screen. That has been replaced with a generic circle icon surrounding the player character. You won't know how much time is left on any of your powerups except the most recent one. 

Without these features the game is, as one user said, butchered. It simply isn't as fun and doesn't contain the depth of strategy it used to. I'd recommend going online and finding a freeware version of the 2002 Crimsonland.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972276327', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1451855128}

author: {'steamid': '76561198124648739', 'num_games_owned': 1579, 'num_reviews': 188, 'playtime_forever': 519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 519, 'last_played': 1440769132}
review:
[h1]Great and addictive top down arcade shooter[/h1]

[i]This is my favorite top down shooter by all means, invested 8 worthy hours but this game deserved it for real.
You grab a gun and you fight hordes of enemies, that's Crimsonland in a nutshell.
There are tons of upgrades to enjoy and use and the gameplay won't leave you behind.
But it's also very simple and straight to the point no strings attached, just hardcore shooting.[/i]

Let's continue to the ratings !

[h1][b]--- Positive points ---[/b][/h1]

[list]
    [*]Straight to the point and addictive gameplay
    [*]Superb controls, no need to keybind
    [*]Trading cards included
    [*]Enough content to play around with
    [*]Achievements are here aswell
[/list]

[h1][b]--- Negative points ---[/b][/h1]

[list]
    [*]More achievements
[/list]

[b]This game is just so positive:[/b]
[i]I can't really find negative points and i invested 8 hours of my life at it and still can't find negative points except that they could include more achievements, but i always prefer to have hundreds of achievements to hunt down.p.[/i]

[b]Summary:[/b]
[i]Great game with a great price tag, totally worth it !
Enough content and enough features!

Happy killing !!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045298730', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1982, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1933, 'last_played': 1520952821}
review:
Crimsonland Ã© um jogo de tiro de visÃ£o aÃ©rea que usa um comando/stick para controlar a movimentaÃ§Ã£o do seu personagem e outro para controlar a direÃ§Ã£o da mira (em inglÃªs: "top-down dual stick arena shooter").

Deixaram o maluco largado sozinho no meio do nada com hordas de bichos feios querendo um pedaÃ§o dele, e Ã© sua missÃ£o meter bala em todos atÃ© nÃ£o sobrar nenhum vivo! 

O sistema de armas Ã© bem variado, com dezenas de opÃ§Ãµes que vÃ£o sendo desbloqueadas aos poucos conforme se avanÃ§a. Ainda existem bonus/"pick-ups" que auxiliam o jogador (e vocÃª vai precisar deles) que aparecem no cenÃ¡rio e podem ser coletados. E existem as "perks", que sÃ£o habilidades que sÃ£o liberadas com uso de EXP.; essas sÃ£o bem variadas e podem ser combinadas para garantir sua sobrevivÃªncia.

O gameplay Ã© repetitivo: vocÃª contra todos os bichos em uma arena que muda os cenÃ¡rios minimamente de fase para fase. Para evitar o enfado e aumentar o replay do jogo, este dispÃµe de de 6 modos de jogo diferentes:

- Quests: Ã© o modo principal do jogo. 6 cenÃ¡rios com 10 fases diferentes cada. Este modo de jogo dispÃµe de 3 nÃ­veis de dificuldade. 

- Survival: nesse modo de sobrevivÃªncia a dificuldade vai aumentando gradativamente e o jogador Ã© desafiado com inimigos cada vez mais fortes e numerosos. Este Ã© o mais semelhante ao "arcade" dos fliperamas.

- Rush: o boneco, uma ak47 intermitente e monstros velocistas. 

- Nukefism: nesse modo o jogador nÃ£o tem nenhuma arma, somente os bonus/"pick-ups" que aparecem no cenÃ¡rio para avanÃ§ar.

- Weapon picker: esse Ã© interessante e requer um pouco de estratÃ©gia. O jogador dispÃµe das armas que aparecem no cenÃ¡rio, com um detalhe: sÃ³ tem um clipe/recarga daquela arma. Acabou? Tem que pegar outra arma no cenÃ¡rio.

- Blitz: igual ao modo survival, sÃ³ que muito mais rÃ¡pido. 

Crimsonland ainda tem um jogo escondido. Ã‰ sÃ³ digitar "gembine" na tela dos crÃ©ditos. Gembine Ã© um puzzle que utiliza um quadro 4X4 onde, para ganhar pontos, deve-se combinar gemas iguais para criar gemas maiores. Quando se cria diversas gemas, Ã© preciso ter cuidado para nÃ£o fazer o movimento errado e colocar gemas que nÃ£o combinam prÃ³ximas, pois isso limitarÃ¡ o movimento do quadro e aÃ­ Ã© game over.



Algumas dicas pra quem gosta de fazer todos os "achievements":

- Nas quests, pause o jogo e digite "grim". No menu secreto selecione "perks em quests" e seja feliz (vale principalmente para terminar o jogo em todas as dificuldades);
- Em "Gembine" fique ligado sempre na prÃ³xima gema que virÃ¡. NÃ£o faÃ§a vÃ¡rios movimentos afobados para formar as gemas maiores, analise o quadro todo primeiro. Procure sempre fazer os movimentos de tal forma que as gemas que se combinem fiquem prÃ³ximas uma das outras. Assim vocÃª ampliarÃ¡ o seu tempo no jogo e a possibilidade de bater o "high score";
- Tenha paciÃªncia em "Spideroids"... (armas como o "flamethrower" ou outra de tiro/recarga rÃ¡pida sÃ£o boas opÃ§Ãµes - eu consegui "not a scratch" usando a metralhadora de plasma).
- Entenda o sistema de perks e combine-as bem, principalmente nos modos survival e blitz. Quando o jogo vai avanÃ§ando muito nos pontos, vocÃª vai depender dos pick-ups para manter-se vivo.  Perks como "telekinetic", "my favourite weapon", "uranion filled bullets", "poison bullets", "greater regeneration" sÃ£o boas opÃ§Ãµes para conseguir pontuaÃ§Ãµes altas.


Recomendo o jogo. Gastei mais tempo com ele do que imaginei que gastaria. Comprei em um Humble Bundle, mas se vocÃª curte jogos semelhantes, pode pegar em uma "steam sale" qualquer que nÃ£o se arrependerÃ¡.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991070980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 9136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1033, 'last_played': 1669096316}
review:
Meant to write a review of this ages ago, but steam didn't play ball and deleted it before I could post it. 
In short - AMAZING FUN GAME!!!
Slightly longer - I have been playing this game casually for years, from the original days. Great concept, challenging and the randomness keeps it interesting. The only slight criticism I have, is that the only way to get the random powerups is to enter some obscure "cheat code", which i always felt was a massive part of the game originally. 
However outside of that, I cannot fault the gameplay. Nation red tried to copy this somewhat, but crimsonland is much better executed in my humble opinion.

Sangre y mÃ¡s sangre en tres modalidades de dificultad con 30 armas muy bien diferenciadas y 66 potenciadores que iremos desbloqueando a medidad que avancemos por los 6 niveles de 10 fases.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072096778', 'num_games_owned': 522, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1596468745}
review: Habituellement, je suis pas un adepte de ce genre de jeu. Mais Crimsonland m'a agrÃ©ablement surpris. La musique colle bien, le choix d'armes est assez bien fait, les pouvoirs qu'on rÃ©cupÃ¨re a cours de la partie peuvent retourner la situation. Les ennemis sont assez diversifiÃ©s dans leurs designs et leurs mouvements. Ce qui rend ce jeu trÃ¨s sypa Ã  jouer, par contre il vaut mieux ne pas y jouer trop longtemps sous peine de perdre le fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970007751', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 9304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1710723860}
review:
What a dissapointment!
1- The game balance has changed so badly, it is not enjoyable anymore. The balance of the game has been destroyed and it is not similar to the original, even remotely.
2- You can not pick the time when to use your upgrades. This is a huge setback for strategic users of the "Bandage". You can not leave it in the list and use it at the time you need it the most. What a let down coming from the coder. What was he thinking?
3- In sake of increasing the number of power-ups, the screen resolution has became a "power up", so you can see better only if it ends up in your power-up list.

There are also some bugs like, right after the "reflex boost" if you have a slow fire rate weapon and the fast shoot option is still available, the fire rate is not consistent. This is distracting the focus and you immediately think that you have to seek another fast shooting bonus. 

As a summary, he made a big mess out of a beautiful game. How things can go horribly wrong for the sake of "forced improvements"

author: {'steamid': '76561198025135104', 'num_games_owned': 3459, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 394, 'last_played': 1455345234}
review:
* Pueden ver la reseÃ±a en video desde Ociotakus: http://www.ociotakus.com/crimsonland-resena/

* Este es un juego muy sencillo en cuanto a su ejecuciÃ³n: top-down shooter, hordas de monstruos y un bestiario bastante amplio de enemigos, habilidades y armas.

* Aunque el juego presume un grandilocuente HD, en realidad tiene unas grÃ¡ficas bastante sencillas que son apenas una mejora de su contraparte en Newsgrounds.

* Que despuÃ©s de haber comprado el juego me pongan el anuncio de una playera en el menÃº principal a veces me da un escozor. Eso no se hace. No.

* A pesar de la premisa tan sencilla del juego, estÃ¡ bien hecho: los controles y la jugabilidad son excelentes y la promesa de una rÃ¡faga rÃ¡pida para un momento de sangre y matanza, es cumplida con creces.

* Hay espacio para cuatro jugadores. Supongo que con amigos, la diversiÃ³n de multiplica. Y la venta de playeras tambiÃ©n.

* Crimsonland, a pesar de su aspecto casual y de acciÃ³n, tiene un amplio rango de logros y de retos para satisfacer a jugadores mÃ¡s exigentes.

* Crimsonland posee un excelente balance. Es una buena compra y los litros de sangre demonÃ­aca vienen garantizados.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018826110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1451340426}
review:
Top down shooter like Smash TV, Dead Frontier, Bunch of Heroes, GTA (1 and 2).  The graphics are okay for this type of game, but there is no music/sound if you just walk and aren't shooting.

The gameplay is too slow for me.  There isn't an option to skip through to the harder levels.  You are forced to play through the easy levels.  The game controls are simple, WASD to move and click to shoot.  Aside from the slow gameplay, the biggest problem for me was that mobs can spawn anywhere.  They do not come in off of the screen, so it's possible to die with full health because they spawn where you are standing.  You literally have no chance to move or defend yourself (this is the only way I was killed twice in the 30 minutes I played.  Level 2 - 8).  The levels appear to be static, so you can learn where they spawn and stay away from those areas, but I didn't like this aspect of the game.

The power ups appear where you kill a mob.  If you are skilled and kill mobs across the screen, due to your slow movement, there's a good chance the power up will disappear before you can loot it.  When a nuke drop (destroys all mobs close to you), you sometimes have to kill the mobs that are close to you to get to it.  By the time you can get it, there are no mobs to destroy with the power up.

There are spawners that pop up (think Gauntlet) which the mobs also spawn from.  I think the game could be a lot better if it had random spawning (off screen) or if they had pure spawners.  The only time I've had a slower runner was in Parasite Eve. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197971470511', 'num_games_owned': 1314, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1507806805}

author: {'steamid': '76561197997651718', 'num_games_owned': 1399, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1669111660}
review:
Crimsonland is a very classic top-down arena survival shooter from late 90's (I seem to have a faint memory of playing the game back then) so it has come a long way since then.

I am reviewing the Linux version of the game as this is the one I played. the hardware requirements are ridiculously low, I played this on an old Acer AspireOne D150 netbook (1.60GHz Atom, 1Â½GB RAM, Intel GMA945) and it ran like a charm, even on a weird 1024x600 resolution.

The gameplay is simple. You control a guy from a top-down perspective and you have a crosshair you aim at different enemies and you shoot them before they overrun you. The game can get very hectic at times but there are weapon pickups and perks that give you a fighting chance against the onslaught of monsters.

The weapons are pretty standard, with some sci-fi ones added in to the mix, ranging from a sub-machine gun to a swarm missile launchers and plasma cannons. They do a good job in being varied while still being simple and useful.

The perks are pretty fun, there is a wide variety from faster experience gain to faster reload or having a poison cloud around you that damages enemies and other quirky things. You get a choice of a few random perks every time you "level up".

This game is deceptively addictive. It is easy to pick up and  play and it will keep you entertained for a little while. It is also good game for an older machine or a netbook to pass a few minutes on a break.

The â‚¬6.99 asking price is a bit steep, but If you can get this during a sale, get it. You will not regret it, it is well worth picking up for a couple of euros.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004481866', 'num_games_owned': 2271, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 961, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 961, 'last_played': 1446782148}
review: Crimsonland is a frantic top-down twin-stick shooter with multiple modes and dozens of unlockable weapons and perks. I found many of the weapons unbalanced, on both ends of the spectrum; I loved using some of them and relied on them whenever I could, and others I avoided at all costs because they felt worthless. On several occasions, I nearly ragequit because some of the levels seemed cheap and impossible to clear without the right (lucky) weapon drop. (To be fair, it's also possible I'm just bad.) Regardless, that didn't stop me from putting in 16 hours, completing all six chapters of the quest mode, and unlocking all of the perks. It was frustrating at times, but more often than not, Crimsonland hit that sweet spot between challenging and frustrating that kept me coming back and giving each level "just one more try."

review: Bought it on sale. Definitely worth that some bucks. I enjoyed the previous crimsonland. It's the same. I played this with a controller, and got what I wanted. Played with friends, it was okay too. If you want some light 2D shooting, for some hours, than this game is a good choice.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993406809', 'num_games_owned': 423, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1484412433}
review:
I came into this having never played the original Crimsonland, and Iâ€™ve got to say itâ€™s grown on me. I wasnâ€™t into it at first. You have to unlock everything by playing the quests, which start off pretty easy, pretty slow. The maps are just flat, and all you do is shoot waves of enemies. The graphics have a very strong old Windows game vibe to them and the soundtrack is cheesy as hell. I didnâ€™t think this had anything more to offer.

But things start to pick up after the first chapter of the quests. By this point I have a good arsenal under my belt, the quests are more challenging and varied, and Iâ€™ve forgotten about my complaints about the flat maps. Itâ€™s all about spreading the crimson. Plus the various survival modes start unlocking, which is really the meat of the game. This is an endless mode where you level up and get perks as time goes on. 

Itâ€™s a basic top-down shooter but fun all the same. Good support for both mouse + keyboard or gamepad. You can have up to three friends easily jump in for co-op, so itâ€™s nice to have in your pocket when you need a quick local multiplayer game. Recommend for fans of the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970374481', 'num_games_owned': 426, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 2410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1899, 'last_played': 1660431167}
review:
"One more game" syndrome at its finest.

- great learning curve
- not another casual twin stick shooter, harcore early 2000's at its finest
- plays great up to 4 players for couch coop
- no fancy graphics, no fancy sounds, no DLCs, no marketing bullshit, just sit and enjoy the carnage

author: {'steamid': '76561198012023582', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 185, 'playtime_forever': 687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 601, 'last_played': 1517177742}
review: Played this when it was a freeware game and it was one of my favourites then. They've ported it to Linux, added a quest mode and a whole bunch of new survival variants. Highly recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994917307', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1449111631}
review:
To start, I'd like to say that I got this game as part of the Humble Android Bundle (some number), and that I only got the bundle for Neverending Nightmares, so this was like a bonus.

I decided to try this game out this week while waiting for my card drops on it. Started the "campaign" (which is basically just some levels with different enemy placements and different enemy and weapon selection for it), finished it in like 3 hours or something. I don't really know if there was a story because I really didn't care, I just wanted to shoot some stuff and see some blood. And it worked. Starts slow with shit weapons and normal enemies, and gradually introduces new enemies, new enemy types, new weapons and perks (which are useable on the Survival gamemode). So yeah, it starts slow and builds up into something cooler quite fast.

Gameplay: Normal top-down, twin-stick shooter, with quite a lot of weapons and different perks. Not many enemy types, but they work in "races", like, aliens, giant spiders, etc. Enemy design is quite okay for a game like this, and the shooting is really solid. Campaign was fun but the Survival gamemode is what really shines here. Lost another 4 hours playing the different survival modes to try to get a highscore. The game IS fun.

Graphics: Well, it was a 200mb download if I remember correctly. There aren't many different scenarios (they are just like a board of dust and sometimes some grass or some urban hangar stuff), which is something I didn't like that much. Enemies have cool designs, wouldn't say "original" but they're cool, you can see the difference from each one. Your character is quite simple and the animations are just fine. Overall, acceptable, though could have some more stuff in scenarios.

Sounds: The menu song made me instantly turn all sounds off because I didn't like the mixing in it (quite low quality), but won't say anything about game effects because I just wanted to kill stuff listening to some prog/death metal.

Story: heh.

Overall: 6/10. Cool game, can easily get you to waste some time of your life playing it and it is fun. Get it for the gameplay if there's a discount and you think this might be for you. Was quite a surprise for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972442672', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317, 'last_played': 1448867761}
review:
Only a couple hours in, and it's exactly what I hoped it would be.  I don't know how faithful to the original it is, but it's the same style of fun I remembered way back in the day.  It ain't deep, but it's not supposed to be.  It's brain candy all the way, and it's good brain candy, at that.

When you need a break from other heaveir stuff, pull this up for an hour and enjoy.  It won't disappoint.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062146008', 'num_games_owned': 1593, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 940, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 940, 'last_played': 1457961337}
review:
Its hard to thumbs down this game as its still a good game.

Its just that for an update to a classic its terrible. The original didnt look as good, but this update just ruins several key gameplay mechanics, while slapping a fresh coat of paint on it.

The reason everyone liked the original was because of the gameplay, even at its release the original was a pretty ugly looking game that [i]played[/i] beautifully which is ultimately what matters.

Its pretty obvious that it has been dumbed down for a controller friendly playstyle

While this still has enough of the original in it to be a pretty good, fun game, honestly just play the original instead of this watered down version.

If the developers just added a "classic mode" toggle in the options which reverted the changes to the perks (specifically telekinesis), put perks back in campaign, basically an option to play a 100% faithful port of the real game with the new improved graphics (which I'm ambivalent on, its not really important for me.), I would gladly give it a thumbs up.

Edit (March 2016):

Well the devs delivered. They fixed every single thing I had a problem with.

Also they gave me what I really wanted all along: The original Crimsonland on Steam. And they gave it away for free as part of the deal along with the remake. I can finally play the original on steam, to add to the couple of hundred hours I have put into it over the years.

Now I can heartily recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969063315', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1447991338}
review: It seems like there would be RPG elements in this game, but there really aren't (except in a few of the survival modes, but not the main game).  The problem is that later levels become increasingly difficult, but instead of being able to choose weapons or perks that you level up, you must be patient and be lucky to receive good weapons and power-ups for each level. It's frustrating because the game would be much more fun if you would be able to start with certain weapons and perks that you can level up, but the game relies heavily on luck because each level randomly spawns different weapons/power ups each time. Not really worth the hassle unless you are a die-hard top-down shooter fan.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988760085', 'num_games_owned': 390, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1766, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 4, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1711860266}
review: I played this game back when it first came out in the early/mid 2000's. It has always been one of my favorites, and me and my brothers have revisited it many many times over the years. Most of the features may not seem so inovative today, but back then they were all revolutionary, at least in my eyes. A vast array of weapons, perks, game modes, secrets, sound effects, enemy types of varying subtle nuance, all make for a very "fun" kickback and chill game. The guitar riff music is simple but memorably inspiring. The multiplayer mode, recently upgraded to allow up to four players, makes for a great group experience. I highly endorse this game.

review:
Una joya de juego, ha mejorado un montÃ³n con respecto al antiguo que saliÃ³ por 2003 si no me equivoco (aunque en realidad lo juguÃ© por 2008).
Llega a ser un poco frustrante en cierto punto, hay pantallas que son extremadamente difÃ­ciles, pero es una total satisfacciÃ³n pasarlas.
Una pena que los records en el modo survival sean una exageraciÃ³n y por lo que veo son records cheteados a lo que es imposible poder llegar a alcanzarlos.
Tiene un montÃ³n de modos de juegos por lo que no se vuelve tan monÃ³tono.
TambiÃ©n cuenta con una gran variedad de enemigos, desde araÃ±as, zombies, aliens y muchas otras criaturas de todos los tipos y colores.
No podrÃ­a faltar nombrar la cantidad de armas que hay, y es que son impresionantes, habiendo las clÃ¡sicas como las pistolas, metralletas, escopetas, bazookas, lanzallamas, hasta pistolas que lanzan ondas de sonido, bazookas de 6 disparos a la vez, metralletas con municiÃ³n elÃ©ctrica, y algunas que ni sÃ© como mierdas nombrarlas. A pesar de eso, no vas a contar con todas las armas en el momento, tienes que ir cogiendolas a medida que aparecen en el mapa matando a un enemigo y en orden aleatorio, por lo que muchas veces toca dudar si cambiar de arma o no.

Pros:
-La variedad de enemigos.
-La variedad de armas y mejoras temporales.
-Muchos modos de juego.
-La mÃºsica, aunque no sea variada estÃ¡ muy buena.
-El detale grÃ¡fico. 
-Modo coop local.
-Cromos.

Contras:
-El precio (aunque se puede conseguir muy barato por cualquier lado)
-Los records del modo survival estÃ¡n fuera de tema.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962425002', 'num_games_owned': 456, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 3127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1142, 'last_played': 1695601973}
review:
Edit: As of Jan 2016 the 1.0.6.1 beta unlocks perks in Quest mode, with which 2.10 and 6.10 are manageable on Hardcore. thanks, now recommended

---

Original: I challenge the devs to record themselves playing 2.10 Spideroids on Hardcore or Grim difficulty, lets see what the trick is and how many deaths it takes you. I give up.

It was already a goddman hard level in the original game but at least you could get lucky with Unstoppable, Long Distance Runner, Plaguebearer, Veins of Poison, or of course Telekinetic perks

There's also an area of maybe 50 pixels around the screen border that you can't walk on, which is really frustrating when it's your only escape route

author: {'steamid': '76561197991350530', 'num_games_owned': 1315, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1611434651}
review:
You've probably already played a hundred different top down horde shooters for free on various flash game websites already. Or at least you have if you were in middle school when I was. So paying the full price for this game would just be silly. It doesn't do anything new or exciting enough to justify a full purchase and is mindless entertainment at best. 

That said, given I just stumbled across this in my library after purchasing some bundle or other, I had a lot of fun with it for a while. It's nothing revolutionary but it has tons of levels, guns, and powerups and is just dumb and satisfying. There's local coop and online leaderboards and generally a lot of features, plus the list of weapons is huge and inventive. All in all I consider it the best version I've played of that shooty thing I used to play on my middleschool lunch breaks, but not one I would recommend shelling out for directly.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990394886', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1484194425}
review: You know exactly what this game is. What you might not realize is just how great a version of that thing it is. Crimsonland is super simple and a joy to play. Shoot things, grab powerups, and stay alive. Gameplay just feels good. Originally released on PC in 2003, Crimsonland's formula proves to be timeless, now even better with the addition of new monsters/levels, Steam leaderboards, and controller support (though I still prefer KB+M for this game). Don't let the simplicity or basic art style of Crimsonland fool you; You will sit down to play for 10 minutes and have an hour of non-stop fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058738018', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1446403630}

author: {'steamid': '76561197962092608', 'num_games_owned': 2359, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1693689812}
review: I loved the original Crimsonland from back before Steam was a thing. This new updated version is alright, I wish they would include the classic version along with it. More importantly, can we get cloud saves or at least permanently unlock the survival modes? Survival with a pulse rifle is a lot more fun than the missions, and every time I have to reinstall Windows, my save with all the unlocks gets wiped, so I have to re-do the missions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007097655', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 4010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3301, 'last_played': 1668848493}
review:
[h1] Mow down enemies with a variety of weapons and perks [/h1]

A new UI and gameplay update to a top-down classic. I've played countless hours off steam and this game is a must-have for the genre. The new UI is slick and ads cool features like an indicator around your cursor. The gameplay update is probably a good thing and not too different from the original but ultimately disappointing from a nostalgic perspective.  If you lost your copy or you've never played before this game is a good pick up. I'd look on sale though because the currently listed $13.99 seems a little steep.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037520882', 'num_games_owned': 695, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1443333464}
review:
A solid topdown shooter. I enjoyed most levels immensely, but a few had me tearing out my hair, especially if you are trying to go for a flawless run. I don't even know how it is possible for some of these levels! That last level will have you frustrated out of your mind! It was great overall and had that one more run appeal. It seems a bit overpriced so try to get it on sale.

7/10 Solid but frustrating at times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045926331', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1443611868}
review:
This top down arcade shooter is quite a bit of fun. My only critisism is about the random perks and weapons. Some of the weapons are just plain garbage and end your run if you accidently pick them up. Don't get a good weapon drop and your run will also be cut short. The same is true for the perks. Some perks are needed to make certain weapons vaible. Some perks are absolutly necisary if you want to get past the 5 minute mark, but luck is not always on your side.

While very fun, there is a lot of luck required for a successful run.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980136699', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 967, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 796, 'last_played': 1558764876}
review:
Crimsonland lives up to it's name; it's solid little top-down gib/gore fest that will have you painting the (slightly) varied vistas red. 
No story, no karma to balance, no bull$#!+... just you, ridiculous unlockable guns and a slithering flood of things you actually wish you could shoot at in your daily life.

That being said... Crimsonland, sadly, isn't prefect. There are a few minor ni99les that keep this title from being worthy of it's full retail cost:
--The soundtrack is hugely lacking. I shut the in-game music off (which oddly only worked sometimes?).
--There is only art-variation in the different lands visited. No rocks, trees, ruins, hills, bunkers....nothing.
--The guns are a little basic and similarly designed. I think the devs could have had a TON a fun here, but sadly they stuck to a set design of weaponry.
--The online leaderboards are completely ruined by l33t-H4X0Rses posting moronic scores and kill counts (wash yer $#!+ once in a while!) 
--Graphically basic. Which is cool, but for the cost; I want more...

So buy this game, but not at full-retail... in fact, don't spend more than $6 for this and you'll be happy with a slow-weeknight blood romp!

author: {'steamid': '76561198080075174', 'num_games_owned': 299, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1444339239}
review: This game is pretty simple, but very challenging. I had to quite a few levels and calm down before coming back to this game. The concept is simple, shoot stuff (bugs, zombies, aliens, etc.) while moving around avoiding being hit. There are a ton of new weapons and it progresses slowly enough to not make it feel impossible. I wouldn't have bought this game but I won it and totally recomend it for anyone looking for some fun shooting and bloody carnage.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977304488', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1442117288}
review: I played this for five hours with only bathroom breaks. Now my mouse arm has very sore muscles because I didn't stretch or take enough breaks. So... I recommend this game heartily. It's pretty straightforward, it's an old-school top-down shooter with interesting weapons and powerups, challenging gameplay, and no frilly nonsense. A+

author: {'steamid': '76561198048688646', 'num_games_owned': 308, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 508, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1477498792}
review: Old version of this game was a legendary, but this version... Need lots of xp for lvlup, and perks are not good as old game's perks...

author: {'steamid': '76561198024861994', 'num_games_owned': 1313, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 550, 'last_played': 1613672679}
review:
Crimsonland is a top down shooter that i recommend 100% if the price is right. the original 14 euros is maybe asking a bit too much but you can usualy find the game for much much cheaper. 

There are lots of weapons to unlock and there are also a good amount of perks that you can get and a fair amount of power ups.  the progression is quite nice and keeps you wanting to play more and more of the game. there are also leaderboards for various game modes so you can compete against freinds or just anyone that have played the game really.  all in all there is alot to do with various difficulities, game modes and weapons/powerups/perks to unlock. very good game for how simple the genre is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025704994', 'num_games_owned': 2343, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 524, 'last_played': 1441680511}
review:
Important notice: contrary to what people think, there is an option to play the game on quest mode with perks. Just pause the game while playing a mission on quest mode and type the word "grim" (without quotes). This must be repeated everytime you launch the game.

I've played this game for many hours on my phone (there the perks option is not hidden) and had lots of fun, and I had an even better experience on my pc, as it is a lot easier to play the game with a controller. This is a really nice top-down shooter with very cool perks, great weapon variety and different game modes that you unlock as you play the quests.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961951106', 'num_games_owned': 1563, 'num_reviews': 289, 'playtime_forever': 1039, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 787, 'last_played': 1517742786}
review: Getting our clique together and taking turns playing the survival mode in Crimsonland is one of my better memories of middle school. 12 years later it still plays and feels great, though obviously there's a lot of nostalgia talking here. The change to the Telekinesis perk is unfortunate, but I kinda understand it (gamepad support). Some of the achievements are unreasonable, which is disappointing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966548833', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 1303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 672, 'last_played': 1530116353}
review:
For me there are a few points that make this not quite as compelling as the original version.
But it's still Crimsonland; it's still fun and better than most other games of the style.

Edit: Having had a chance to play some local multiplayer with xbox pads, I'll say that's a pretty good plus in the new version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030735248', 'num_games_owned': 1531, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1452750176}
review:
Overpriced and underwhelming, this very generic top-down shooter can be yours for $14.99. It feels like a bottom-tier mobile game. Just grab an SNES (or MAME) emulator and play some Smash TV or Total Carnage instead.

Avoid unless you're looking to try out Steam's new refund system.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085477871', 'num_games_owned': 1329, 'num_reviews': 201, 'playtime_forever': 678, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1666935614}
review: Start a game in QUEST mode, pause, type [i]grim[/i] and restart. This game juts became a lot more fun. Mid mission perks introduce an element of randomness that players of [i]The Binding of Isaac Rebirth[/i] will approve of. Despite the titanically stilted xp gain, Crimsonland still feels pretty fun to play, but the unashamed title screen cashgrab neccessitates you buy this cheaply.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118732199', 'num_games_owned': 2673, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 554, 'last_played': 1440695971}
review:
A fun time killing top-view run and kill type of game. It stands out from other similar games by its massive enemy counts and tons of blood. 

-= About the game itself =-

Game's campaign consist of 6 chapters and each of them have 10 levels. Depending on your skills and guns you pick up each level takes no longer than 10 minutes, but with every new level your enemies become harder to kill same as their count on map grows. By completing levels like in any other game you unlock new perks and guns.

Campaign kept me busy for around 3,5 hour, while after the finish game still offers you a replay in harder difficulties. If you feel that you don't want to start it all over again, you always can choose one of 5 different survivals. Each new survival unlocks as you progress in a game's campaign.  

On top of that you can play this game with up to 4 friends in co-op which makes it to be even more fun and later compare your highscores with the rest of the world.

Personally I don't have nothing to say bad about games mechanics and or gameplay, it is really entertaining, but one thing kind of bothers me and it is that when you pick up a gun your previous gun disappears and there are no possible way to scroll between weapons, so you have to kill with a gun you take. At some point, accidentally picking up a worse gun can cost you a restart, so you have to be careful on what gun you are about to take. 

After all it is totally worth to have this game in your library.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094115473', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 7859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1659447508}
review:
I changed my review since the option to play the 2003 game was added. That's the game I would wholeheartedly recommend to anyone. 

The review below is talking about the remake.

What a disappointment. I lost weeks and weeks and failed many exams because of how fun and addictive the original was.
First of all, the style of the game is changed - I assume they wanted to give it a more modern look, but it just looks like an amateur designed it. Menus, illustrations of weapons, even sprites of your player and the enemies, they all look so ugly and plastic. Sure, they made the terrain more detailed, but who gives a shit about that? Also, you are now much closer to the ground and your player, so you don't see as much field as you used to. Meaning, less room to move. 

The gameplay is basically the same, and many people will think that it is enough - perhaps before they play the game. Important part of the first game was perk selecting (there are still power-ups that you can pick up in the game, they appear after you destroy a random enemy) you could basically level your player in every part of the quest, and start over in the next chapter. It was so fun to choose perks while playing, you had to make the choice between those offered and sometimes it was really choosing the lesser evil. Now, you want to choose perks in a quest mode? Fuck you. You can't.

Energy bar is shown in a circle around your player, this is another annoying thing because it draws your attention from enemies and the level. It's bright blue, yeah, seems like someone at 10tons has a bright blue fetish. 
A HUGE miss is the fact that your ammo count isn't in the corner or at the top of the screen - it's NEXT TO YOUR CROSSHAIR. How are you supposed to aim if often you aren't sure what your crosshair is? I really can not understand what were they thinking while redesigning this game.

-------

I stand by my words - the redesign made the game worse. This game is worth the money because you can play the 2003 version, and that one rocks so damn hard. Play it, enjoy it (quite annoying that you have to run it from Steam every time so that you'd get a pop-up asking you which version you want to run; if you just click on the shortcut on your desktop, you'd get the shitty version and no one wants that).
Redesigned version is useless.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987761138', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1440428364}
review:
Oh come on!!! How can this game cost 13 dollars this is INSANEEEEE!!!!
I bought it with other 8 games (all superior to this) for about 3 dollars.
When I played it on steam without checking anything about the game I though 
"Wow this game sucks. It must cost about 3 dollars. This game seems so cheap".

This game isnt only not worth your time but especially your money. The main question is:
Why pay to play this game when you could play 100 same flashgames for free?

I could hardly play the 5 mins the reviews require.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071907114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1440342796}
review:
